first: Tha Forefaithers o Jesus tha Messiah  Here ïs tha femlie line o Jesus Christ, tha sinn o Davit an o Abraham:  Abraham wus tha faither o Isaac, Isaac tha faither o Jacob, Jacob tha faither o Judah an hïs brithers.
second: An thair wus a hale thrang o fowk gethert, tha maist o thaim spreedin thair claes on tha róad, while ithers sneddit brenches aff tha trees, an the' strewed thaim on tha pad fer hïm tae ride ower.

first: An Judah wus tha faither o Perez an Zerah, an thair mither wus Tamar.
second: Whan haird times an trouble cums acause o God's wurd, he jist gies up thair an then.

first: Perez wus tha faither o Hezron, Hezron tha faither o Ram.
second: Fer saed she til hirsel, “If A can jist touch hïs cloke, A wull be made weel agane.” Jesus turnt roon an saen hir.

first: Ram wus tha faither o Amminadab, Amminadab tha faither o Nahshon, an Nahshon tha faither o Salmon.
second: Love fer yer enemies  Yis hae heerd that ït wus saed, ‘Love yer nighber an hait yer enemie.’ But A tell ye: Love yer enemies an pray fer thaim that traits ye ïll, that ye micht be childèr o yer Faither ïn heiven.

first: Salmon wus tha faither o Boaz, an tha mither o Boaz wus Rahab.
second: Sae, whaiver maks lïttle o thairsels an becums laik thïs wean ïs tha maist impoartin ïn tha Kïngdom o Heiven.

first: Boaz wus tha faither o Obed, an tha mither o Obed wus Ruth.
second: If oniebodie says ocht tae ye, tell hïm ‘tha Loard haes need o thaim’, an he'll senn thaim richt awa.” Thïs cum aboot fer tae fülfill whut wus spauk throu tha proaphit:  “Say tae tha dochtèr o Zion,  ‘Luk see, yer kïng ïs on hïs wye tae ye,  gentle an ridin on a cuddie,  on a cowlt, tha foal o a cuddie.’ ”  Tha follaers gan awa an daen as the' wur bïd.

first: Obed wus tha faither o Jesse, an Jesse tha faither o Kïng Davit.
second: Sae he left thaim, an he gan awa agane an prayed tha thurd time, sayin tha same thïng.

first: Davit wus tha faither o Solomon, bi hir that wus yinst tha wife o Uriah.
second: An oniebodie that says, ‘Ye oul fool!’ wull be rinnin tha risk o hell fire.

first: Solomon wus tha faither o Rehoboam, Rehoboam tha faither o Abijah, Abijah tha faither o Asa, Asa tha faither o Jehoshaphat, Jehoshaphat tha faither o Jehoram, Jehoram tha faither o Uzziah.
second: The' cum tae ye lukkin laik hairmless sheep, but on tha inside the'r naethin but a paak o wolfs.

first: Uzziah wus tha faither o Jotham, Jotham tha faither o Ahaz, Ahaz tha faither o Hezekiah.
second: But whaniver that sarvint gaed oot, he cum on yin o hïs fella sarvints that owed hïm twarthie thoosan pun.

first: Hezekiah wus tha faither o Manasseh, Manasseh tha faither o Amon, an Amon tha faither o Josiah.
second: An whaniver the' heerd Jesus wus passin bye, the' cryed oot, “Loard, Sinn o Davit, tak peetie on iz!” Tha thrang chackt thaim an toul thaim tae be quait, but the' guldèrt aa tha mair, sayin, “Loard, Sinn o Davit, tak peetie on iz!” Whaniver he heerd thaim, Jesus stapt.

first: Josiah wus tha faither o Jeconiah an hïs brithers.
second: An then Jesus toul thaim, “Thïs verie nicht al o yis wull faa awa on accoont o me, fer as ït's writ: ‘A wull strike tha shepherd, an tha sheep o tha flock wull be scattèrt.’ But eftèr A hae ris frae tha deid, A'll tak tha foreróad o ye ïntae Galilee.” An Petèr spauk oot, “Tha mair tha rest'll faa awa becas o ye, A niver wull!” “A tell ye tha truith,” Jesus saed bak, “thïs verie nicht, afore tha roostèr craas, ye'll say thrie times ower that ye dïnnae ken me.” But Petèr spauk oot agane, “E'en ïf A hae tae dee alang wi ye, A wull niver deny ye!” An aa tha ither follaers vood tha same.

first: That wus roon aboot tha time the' wur cairriet aff tae Babylon.
second: Thair's naethin covert ower that'll no cum tae licht, ner hïd that'll no be kent.

first: An eftèr the' wur cairriet awa tae Babylon, Jeconiah becum tha faither o Shealtiel, an Shealtiel tha faither o Zerubbabel.
second: Tha weeds stans fer tha childèr o tha wïckit yin, an tha enemie that sows thaim ïs tha Deil.

first: Zerubbabel wus tha faither o Abiud, Abiud tha faither o Eliakim, an Eliakim tha faither o Azor.
second: Yit no yin o thaim wull faa tae tha grun wioot yer Faither knowin ït.

first: Azor wus tha faither o Zadok, Zadok tha faither o Akim, an Akim tha faither o Eliud.
second: Then Jesus saed tae hïm, “Luk here, mine ye dïnnae tell oniebodie.

first: Eliud wus tha faither o Eleazar, Eleazar tha faither o Matthan, an Matthan tha faither o Jacob.
second: Jesus foretells hïs deith  Frae that time on Jesus stairtit tae mak ït clear tae hïs follaers that he maun gae tae Jerusalem, an he maun suffer monies a thïng at tha hans o tha eldèrs, tha heid preeshts an tha maistèrs o tha Laa.

first: An Jacob wus tha faither o Joseph, an Joseph wus merriet tae Mary.
second: Sae whut am A tae dae wi Jesus that's caad tha Christ?” Pilate axt.

first: An Mary wus tha mither o Jesus, tha Yin caad Christ.
second: Luk, yer Hoose haes bin forsook, an noo ït's empie.

first: That made fowerteen genèrations ïn aa frae Abraham tae Davit, fowerteen frae Davit til the' wur cairriet awa tae Babylon, an anither fowerteen frae that tae tha cumin o Christ.
second: Thair wull be dirths, [plagues] an irthquakes ïn monie pairts.

first: Jesus tha Messiah ïs boarn  An thïs ïs hoo tha birth o Jesus Christ cum aboot: hïs mither Mary wus promist tae Joseph, but afore the' cum thegither, she fun oot she wus wi a wean.
second: Luk, A hae toul ye aforehan, sae as ye'll know.

first: An ït wus bi tha Halie Spïrit.
second: Monies a yin'll say tae me on tha Day o Reckonin, ‘Loard, Loard, dïd we no proaphesy ïn yer name, an ïn yer name dïd we no drive oot ïll spïrits an dae a hale lock o mïracles?’ Then A wull tell thaim strecht, ‘A niver knowed ye.

first: Noo Joseph hir husban wus a dacent man an he dïdnae want hir tae be affrontit, sae he thocht tae senn hir awa on tha quait.
second: If a blin man taks anither blin man bi tha airm, tha baith o thaim wull faa ïntae tha sheuch.” Petèr saed tae Jesus, “Tell iz whut that ither parable wus aboot.” “Ir yous slow on tha uptake tae?” Jesus axt thaim.

first: He wus thïnkin aboot aa thïs, whan lo an behoul, an angel o tha Loard appeart tae hïm ïn a draim an saed, “Joseph, sinn o Davit, dïnnae be feart tae tak Mary fer yer wife, fer tha wean she's cairryin ïs o tha Halie Spïrit.
second: A paralysed man made bettèr  Jesus climmed ïntae a bóat, sailed ower tha ither side an cum tae hïs ain toon.

first: She wull hae a sinn, an ye ir tae gie hïm tha name Jesus, fer he wull save hïs ain fowk frae thair wrangdaeins.” Noo aa thïs wus daen tae brïng aboot whut tha Loard haed saed throu tha proaphit:  “A virgin wull cairrie a wean, a sinn,  an whan he's boarn, he'll be caad Immanuel”  - mainin “God ïs wi iz.”  Whaniver Joseph waakent up, he daen whut tha angel o tha Loard haed toul hïm tae dae, an he tuk Mary hame fer tae be hïs wife.
second: Iverie tree that daesnae gie guid fruit ïs cut doon an throwed ïntae tha fire.

first: But he dïdnae sleep wi hir til eftèr tha wean wus boarn.
second: Fer ye swallae up weedas' hooses an ye mak lang prayers fer a show; sae yis'll be condemned aa tha mair.] Wae faa ye, maistèrs o tha Laa an Pharisees, ye hippycrates!

first: An he caad hïm bi tha name Jesus.
second: Cum alang wi me, an share yer maistèr's happiness!’ Then alang cum tha man that wus gien tha yin baag o siller.

first: Tha spaemen frae tha East  Eftèr Jesus wus boarn ïn Bethlehem ïn Judea, durin tha time that Herod wus Kïng, spaemen frae tha East cum tae Jerusalem an the' axt, “Whar ïs tha yin that haes bin boarn Kïng o tha Jews?
second: Whaniver tha Pharisees saen thïs, the' axt hïs follaers, “Whut's yer maistèr daein aitin wi thaim tex men an sïnners?” On hearin thïs, Jesus saed, “It ïs no thaim that's weel needs a doctèr, but thaim that's seeck.

first: Fer we hae saen hïs starn ïn tha East an hae cum fer tae woarship hïm.” Whaniver Kïng Herod heerd thïs, he wus baadlie püt aboot, an aa Jerusalem wi hïm.
second: Why thïs waste?” the' axt.

first: Sae he brocht thegither aa tha Jewish fowk's heid preeshts an maistèrs o tha Laa, an he axt thaim whar tha Christ wus tae be boarn.
second: Frae then on Judas wus lukkin fer a chaunce tae han hïm ower.

first: In Bethlehem o Judea,” the' saed, “fer thïs ïs whut tha proaphit writ: ‘But you, Bethlehem, ïn tha lan o Judah, ye ir bi nae mains tha laist amang tha rulers o Judah; fer oot o you wull cum a ruler that wull herd ma fowk Israel.’ ”  Then Herod caad tha wise men thegither on tha quait, an he fun oot frae thaim whan ït wus that tha starn haed cum ïntae sicht.
second: He stapt thair til Herod deed.

first: He sent thaim tae Bethlehem an he toul thaim, “Luk ïn iverie airt fer tha wean.
second: Dïnnae tell lees aboot ither fowk’.

first: As shuin as yis fin hïm, wud ye brïng me wurd, sae as A can gae an woarship hïm as weel!” Eftèr the' haed heerd whut tha kïng haed tae say, the' set aff on thair wye, an lo an behoul, tha starn the' haed saen ïn tha East went aheid o thaim, til ït stapt richt ower tha place whar tha wean wus.
second: Furst clain tha inside o tha bicker [an tha plate], an then tha ootside wull be clain as weel.

first: Whaniver the' saa tha starn, the' wur hairt gled.
second: Alang wi hïm wus a bïg thrang airmed wi swords an stavs, sent oot frae tha heid preeshts an tha eldèrs o tha fowk.

first: The' cum ïntae tha hoose, the' saen tha wee wean wi hïs mither Mary, an the' bood doon an wurshipt hïm.
second: Noo whaniver tha sodgers haed nailt hïm tae tha cross, the' gemmelt amang thairsels tae dïvide hïs claes.

first: Then the' apent thair kïsts an the' set afore hïm thair gifts o gowld an frankincense an myrrh.
second: A tell ye tha truith, the' hae got aa the'ir gaun tae get.

first: An bein warnt ïn a draim no tae gae bak tae Herod, the' tuk anither róad bak hame.
second: But A tell ye that Sodom wull be bettèr aff on tha day o Reckonin ner you.”  Ma yauk ïs aisie  At that time Jesus saed, “Faither, Loard o heiven an irth, A praise ye that ye hae kep these thïngs frae clivir an warlie-wise fowk, an made thaim clear eneuch fer weans tae unnèrstan.

first: Joseph an Mary flee awa tae Egypt  An eftèr the' went awa, an angel o tha Loard appeart tae Joseph ïn a draim.
second: Frae then on Judas wus lukkin fer a chaunce tae han hïm ower.

first: Git up,” he toul hïm, “tak aff tae Egypt wi tha wean an hïs mither.
second: In tha same wye, let yer licht shine afore iveriebodie, sae as the' wull see yer guid warks an gie glorie tae yer Faither ïn heiven.

first: Bide thair til A gie ye tha wurd, fer Herod ïs aboot tae hunt oot tha wean fer tae dae awa wi hïm.” Sae up Joseph got, he tuk tha wean an hïs mither wi hïm ïn tha mïddle o tha nicht, an he set aff fer Egypt.
second: Ye cannae sarve baith God an Gowld.

first: He stapt thair til Herod deed.
second: Yous bide here an stye awaak wi me.” He gan forrit a weethin, then he bood doon wi hïs face tae tha grun an he prayed, “Ma Faither, ïf ït ïs poassible, may thïs cup o sufferin be tuk awa frae me.

first: An aa thïs brocht aboot whut tha Loard haed saed throu tha proaphit: “Oot o Egypt A hae caad ma sinn.”  Whaniver Herod fun oot he'd bin haad, he wus rïppin, an he gien oardèrs fer tae kïll aa tha weechils ïn Bethlehem an roon aboot, thaim at wus twa yeir oul an unnèr, takkin ïntae accoont tha time he haed bin telt bi tha spaemen.
second: Whan tha evenin wus weel on, Jesus wus at tha boord alang wi tha Twal.

first: Then whut tha proaphit Jeremiah saed aforehan wud happen cum aboot: “A voice wus heerd ïn Ramah, greetin an lamentin.
second: Frae tha time Jhone tha Baptiser stairtit tae praich up til noo, fowk ir tryin tae püsh thair wye ïntae tha Kïngdom o Heiven, an violent men ir takkin houl o ït.

first: It wus Rachel greetin fer hir weans; an she niver devalved, acause hir weans wus nae lang'r wi hir.”  Tha femlie cums bak tae Nazareth  But whaniver Herod deed, lo an behoul, an angel o tha Loard appeart ïn a draim tae Joseph ïn Egypt an he saed, “Git up, tak tha wean an hïs mither awa tae tha lan o Israel, fer tha yins that wus gaun tae kïll tha wean ïs deid.” Sae Joseph upt an tuk tha wean an hïs mither an he went ïntae tha lan o Israel.
second: An hïm that sweers bi tha Hoose o God sweers bi ït, an bi tha Yin that leeves ïn ït.

first: But whan he heerd that Archelaus wus tha Kïng o Judea ïn tha ruim o hïs faither Herod, he wus feart tae gae thair.
second: Fer whut's ïn yer hairt wull cum oot o yer mooth.

first: Bein warnt ïn a draim, he pued bak tae tha dïstrict o Galilee, an he went an settelt doon ïn a toon caad Nazareth.
second: Ang'uish ïn Gethsemane  Then Jesus gaed wi hïs follaers tae a place caad Gethsemane, an he toul thaim, “Sït here while A gang ower thair an pray.” He tuk Petèr an tha twa sinns o Zebedee alang wi hïm, an he begun tae be wile sorrafu an gye troublet.

first: Jhone tha Baptiser maks tha wye readie fer Jesus  In thaim days Jhone tha Baptiser cum praichin ïn tha wiles o Judea an sayin, “Turn awa frae yer sïns, fer tha Kïngdom o Heiven ïs nearhan.” Jhone ïs tha yin tha proaphit Isaiah spauk aboot, tellin: “Thair's a voice cryin oot ïn tha wiles, ‘Mak tha wye readie fer tha Loard, mak hïs pads strecht fer hïm!’ ” Jhone's claes wus made o kemel's hair, an he haed a leather belt roon hïs mïddle.
second: An then A'll tell tha reapers: Gether up tha weeds furst an tye thaim up ïn bunnels fer burnin; then awa an gether up tha wheat an brïng ït ïntae ma barn.’ ”  Tha wee mustèrt seed  Jesus toul thaim yit anither parable: “Tha Kïngdom o Heiven ïs laik a wee mustèrt seed, that a man tuk an sowed ïn hïs fiel.

first: An he leeved bi aitin gresshoppers an wile honey.
second: Ye ir a thrip-stane tae me; fer ye gie nae thocht tae tha thïngs o God.

first: Croods gaed oot tae hïm frae Jerusalem alang wi aa tha fowk frae Judea an tha hale dïstrict o tha rïver Joardan.
second: Then ït says, ‘A'll jist gae bak tae whar A wus leevin afore.’ Whaniver ït gaes bak, ït fins tha hoose empie, swep clain an aa redd up.

first: An thaim at confesst thair sïns wur baptised bi hïm ïn tha Joardan rïver.
second: Hïs follaers wur hung'rie got, an the' begun tae pluck tha heids aff tha coarn an the' et thaim.

first: But whan he saa a wheen o Pharisees an Sadducees cumin tae whar he wus baptisin, he saed tae thaim, “Ye sleekit shooer o vipers!
second: An thair wus a man thair an hïs richt han wus wuthert.

first: Wha telt ye tae rin frae tha wrath o God that's cumin?
second: Luk see, A hae got twa mair fer ye.’ Hïs maistèr saed, ‘Ye hae daen weel, ye guid an faithfu sarvint!

first: Ye maun show bi tha wye ye leeve that ye hae turnt awa frae yer sïns.
second: We want Barabbas!” the' answert.

first: An dïnnae be thïnkin tae yersels, ‘We hae Abraham fer oor faither’ an hae daen wi that.
second: Jesus went bak ïntae tha Temple gruns, an while he wus taichin, tha heid preeshts an tha Jewish eldèrs cum up tae hïm.

first: A tell ye that oot o thon stanes God can mak weans fer Abraham.
second: Tell hïm, ‘Tha Maistèr says, Ma time ïs nearhan, an A'm gaun tae celebrate tha Passower wi ma follaers at yer hoose.’ ” Sae hïs follaers daen jist as Jesus haed bïd thaim, an the' made readie tha boord fer tha Passower mail.

first: God's hatchit ïs noo at tha ruit o tha trees, an thaim that dïnnae gie guid fruit wull be fellt, an pïtcht ïntae tha fire.
second: Whut's mair impoartin: tha gift, or tha althar that maks tha gift halie?

first: A'm baptisin yis wi wattèr fer tae show yis hae repentit.
second: Na, A dïdnae cum tae brïng peace, but a sword.

first: But thair's yin cumin eftèr me that ïs michtier ner me.
second: An whaniver ït wus hairvest time, he sent hïs sarvints tae tha fairmers fer tae collect tha fruit.

first: A'm no fït tae cairrie hïs buits.
second: A'm tellin ye, jist be on yer gaird agin tha yeast o tha Pharisees an Sadducees.” An then the' unnèrstud that he wus no tellin thaim tae gaird agin tha yeast uised ïn breid, but agin tha taichin o tha Pharisees an Sadducees.

first: He wull baptise ye wi tha Halie Spïrit an wi fire.
second: Whaniver the' got ït, the' stairtit tae grummle agin tha fairmer.

first: Hïs winnowin fork ïs ïn hïs han, an he wull redd up hïs thrashin-flure, getherin hïs wheat ïntae hïs barn an burnin tha caff wi a fire ye cannae pit oot.”  Jesus baptised bi Jhone  Then Jesus cum frae Galilee tae tha Joardan fer tae be baptised bi Jhone.
second: Noo tha heid preeshts an tha hale Cooncil wus lukkin fer men that wud wutness agin Jesus, sae the' cud pit hïm tae deith.

first: But Jhone tried tae pit hïm aff, sayin, “It's me that needs tae be baptised bi you, an you ir cumin tae me?” Jesus saed, “Jist dae thïs fer noo; fer thïs ïs tha richt thïng fer iz tae dae, tae cairrie oot tha wull o God.” Sae Jhone gien ïn.
second: The' wull condemn hïm tae deith, an the'll turn hïm ower tae tha Gentiles fer tae be mockt an whuppt an hung up on a cross.

first: Tha mïnit Jesus wus baptised, he ris up oot o tha wattèr, an jist wi that tha heivens apent, an he saa tha Spïrit o God cumin doon laik a doo an lichtin on hïm.
second: It ïs writ doon,” he saed tae thaim, “that ‘ma hoose wull be caad a hoose o prayer’, but yous ir turnin ït ïntae a den o robbers!”  Tha blin an tha lameters cum tae hïm thair ïn tha Hoose o God, an he made thaim bettèr.

first: Jesus tempit bi tha Deil  Then Jesus wus taen bi tha Spïrit ïntae tha wuldèrness fer tae be tempit bi tha Deil.
second: Then he saed tae ït, “May ye niver bair fruit agane!” An at yinst tha tree wuthert up.

first: Eftèr gaun wioot mait fer fowertie days an fowertie nichts, he wus gye hung'rie.
second: But A'm tellin ye, Elijah haes cum aareadie, an the' dïdnae ken wha he wus, but the' daen tae hïm aa the' wantit.

first: Tha tempter cum tae hïm an saed, “If ye ir tha Sinn o God, tell thaim thair stanes tae turn ïntae breid.” Jesus saed bak tae hïm, “It ïs writ: ‘Man cannae leeve bi breid alane, but bi iverie wurd at cums frae tha mooth o God.’ ” Then tha Deil tuk hïm tae tha halie cïtie an stud hïm up on tha verie tap o tha Hoose o God.
second: An as he wus scattèrin ït, some drapt doon alang tha pad, an tha burds flew doon an peckt thaim up.

first: If ye ir tha Sinn o God,” saed he, “throw yersel doon!
second: Fer ye trevel ower lan an sea tae git a sing'l convert, an whaniver he cums roon tae yer wye o thïnkin, ye mak hïm twice as much a sinn o hell as yis ir yersels.

first: Fer tha Guid Buik says: ‘He wull tell hïs angels tae luk eftèr ye, an wi thair hans the' wull haud ye up, fer fear ye dunt yer fit agin a stane.’ ” Jesus saed bak tae hïm, “It's ïn tha Buik forbye: ‘Ye ir no tae temp tha Loard yer God.’ ” An nixt thïng, tha Deil tuk hïm tae a bïg heich muntin an lut hïm see aa tha kïngdoms o tha warl ïn aa thair glorie.
second: Dïnnae tak whut's no yer ain’.

first: A wull gie ye aa thïs,” he saed, “ïf ye'll jist boo doon an woarship me.” Jesus saed tae hïm, “Awa or that, Satan!
second: An oniebodie that daesnae tak up hïs cross an follae me ïs no warthie o me.

first: Fer ït ïs writ doon: ‘Ye ir tae woarship tha Loard yer God an tae sarve naebodie but hïm.’ ” Then tha Deil lut hïm be, an angels cum an lukt eftèr hïm.
second: Tha same thïng happent tae tha saicont brither an tha thurd, richt on doon tae tha seiventh.

first: Tha stairt o Jesus' mïnistrie  Noo whan Jesus heerd tha wittins that Jhone haed bin püt ïn jail, he went bak ïntae Galilee.
second: He gaed tae tha tomb, an he rowlt bak tha stane an he sut on ït.

first: An eftèr leain Nazareth, he gaed tae Capernaum an he stapt thair.
second: Aa o a suddent, thair wus a michtie irthquake, fer an angel o tha Loard cum doon frae heiven!

first: Capernaum wus bi tha Loch ïn tha dïstrict o Zebulun an Naphtali -- tae brïng aboot whut wus foretoul bi tha proaphit Isaiah:  “In tha lan o Zebulun an tha lan o Naphtali,  on tha wye tae tha Loch, on tha ither side o tha Joardan,  ïn Galilee whar tha Gentiles leeve -  tha fowk that sut ïn tha dairk  hae saa a bricht licht;  an on tha yins leevin ïn tha lan o tha shedda o deith,  tha licht haes cum ïn.”  Frae then on Jesus begun tae praich, “Turn awa frae yer sïns, fer tha Kïngdom o Heiven haes cum nearhan ye.”  Jesus' furst follaers  Yin day, whan Jesus wus waakin alang tha loch shore o Galilee, he saa twa brithers, Simon caad Petèr an hïs brither Andra.
second: Hoo can ye say tae yer brither, ‘Let me tak tha skelf oot o yer ee,’ whan luk, aa tha time thair ïs a plenk ïn yer ain ee?

first: The' wur ïn a bóat wi thair faither Zebedee, mennin thair neyts.

first: Jesus maks aa kines o seeck fowk bettèr  Jesus trevelt aa roon Galilee, taichin ïn thair Meetin Hooses, an praichin tha Guid Wittins o tha Kïngdom, an curin iverie disaise an ailment amang tha fowk.

second: An whan Jesus wus daen tellin these parables, he gaed on frae thair, an bak tae hïs hametoon.

first: Bïg croods follaed hïm frae Galilee, an tha Ten Toons, an Jerusalem, an Judea an tha dïstrict on tha ither side o tha rïver Joardan.

second: An jist then thair appeart afore thaim Moses an Elijah, an the' wur taakin wi Jesus.

first: Blisst ir tha yins that greet, fer the' wull be comfortit.

second: Loard, save me!” he caad oot.

first: A tell ye tha truith, afore heiven an irth passes awa, no tha weeest lettèr, ner even tha weeest stroke o a pen, wull pass awa frae tha Laa afore iveriethin God wants fer ït ïs brocht aboot.
second: Petèr kens Jesus ïs tha Messiah  Whaniver Jesus cum tae tha dïstrict o Caesarea Phïlippi, he axt hïs follaers, “Wha dae fowk say tha Sinn o Man ïs?” The' saed, “A wheen say Jhone tha Baptiser; some wud say Elijah; an still ithers, Jeremiah or yin o tha proaphits.” “But whut aboot yersels?” he axt.

first: Oniebodie that breks yin o these commauns, even tha laist o thaim, an lairns ithers tae dae tha same, wull be laist thocht o ïn tha Kïngdom o Heiven, but whaiver keeps these commauns an lairns ithers tae dae thaim, wull be gye weel thocht o ïn tha Kïngdom o Heiven.

first: An oniebodie that says, ‘Ye oul fool!’ wull be rinnin tha risk o hell fire.

first: Awa an mak ït up wi yer brither furst; then cum bak an gie yer offerin ïn.

first: But Jesus slep throu ït.

first: Hïs follaers cum an waakent hïm, sayin, “Loard, save iz, or we'll aa be droont!” “Hoo cum yis ir sae feart?” saed he.

first: Hae yis nae faith ava?” Then he stud up an chackt tha wun an tha waves, an ït wus aa peace an quaitness.

first: Tha verie wun an tha waves daes hïs bïddin!”  Jesus senns tha ïll spïrits ïntae tha pïgs  An whan he got tae tha ither side o tha loch, tae tha lan whar tha Gadarenes leeved, thair wus these twa men cum oot frae tha graveyaird fer tae meet hïm.

first: Hae ye cum here tae torment iz afore tha day o Reckonin?” A bït awa frae thaim, a bïg herd o pïgs wus hokin fer food.
second: But A'm tellin ye, Elijah haes cum aareadie, an the' dïdnae ken wha he wus, but the' daen tae hïm aa the' wantit.

second: An thair wus a hale thrang o fowk gethert, tha maist o thaim spreedin thair claes on tha róad, while ithers sneddit brenches aff tha trees, an the' strewed thaim on tha pad fer hïm tae ride ower.

first: Tha yins lukkin eftèr tha pïgs run aff; the' gaed ïntae tha toon an toul iveriebodie aa that haed tuk place, an whut haed happent tae tha men bothert wi ïll spïrits.
second: Fer we hae saen hïs starn ïn tha East an hae cum fer tae woarship hïm.” Whaniver Kïng Herod heerd thïs, he wus baadlie püt aboot, an aa Jerusalem wi hïm.

first: Then tha hale toon gaed oot tae meet Jesus.

first: An whan the' saen hïm, the' plaidit wi hïm tae lea thair pairt o tha kintrie.

second: But seein as he haes nae ruits, ït onlie houls wi hïm fer a wee while.

first: But jist sae as ye'll ken tha Sinn o Man haes tha pooer tae forgie sïns here on irth...” - he then saed tae tha paralysed man - “Up ye get, lïft yer bed an gae hame.” An tha man stud up, sae he dïd, an he went awa hame.
second: An whaniver the' heerd Jesus wus passin bye, the' cryed oot, “Loard, Sinn o Davit, tak peetie on iz!” Tha thrang chackt thaim an toul thaim tae be quait, but the' guldèrt aa tha mair, sayin, “Loard, Sinn o Davit, tak peetie on iz!” Whaniver he heerd thaim, Jesus stapt.

first: Whan tha thrang saen thïs, the' wur fïllt wi wunnèrment; an the' gien glorie tae God fer giein sitchana thortie tae a man.

first: Follae me,” he toul hïm, an Mattha ris up an follaed hïm.

second: Roon aboot five ïn tha eftèrnuin he gaed oot an fun still ithers stannin roon ïn tha mairket place.

second: But iverie yin that hears these wurds o mine an daesnae heed thaim ïs laik a gormless man that bigged hïs hoose on san.

first: But awa an lairn tha mainin o thïs Scrïpture: ‘It's mercie A'm eftèr, A'm no eftèr secryfice.’ Fer A hinnae cum fer tae caa tha guid fowk [tae repent], A hae cum fer tae caa sïnners.”  Tae fast or no tae fast  An ït wus then that Jhone's follaers cum up an axt hïm, “Hoo ïs ït that tha Pharisees an us ir aye fastin, but your follaers dïnnae fast?” Jesus saed bak tae thaim, “Dae ye thïnk tha waddin guests wud murn while tha bridegruim ïs still wi thaim?
second: If he lïstens tae ye, ye hae wun yer brither ower.

first: Thair'll cum a day but, whaniver tha bridegruim wull be tuk awa frae thaim; an ït's then the'll be fastin.

first: Naebodie patches thair oul duds wi a bït o new claith, fer tha patch'll pu awa an mak ït waur.

first: Na, the' poor new wine ïntae new wineskïns, an tha baith o thaim wull keep.”  A wumman hailt an a wee lass brocht bak tae life  Noo whaniver he wus sayin thïs, a heidyin o tha Meetin Hoose cum an got doon on hïs knees afore hïm an saed, “Ma wee dochtèr haes deed jist thair noo.

first: But cum an pit yer han on hir, an she'll cum bak tae life.” An Jesus got up an gaed wi hïm, as weel as hïs follaers.

first: An lo an behoul, thair wus thïs wumman that wus bothert wi bleedin fer twal yeir.

first: She cum up behin hïm an toucht tha enn o hïs cloke.

second: Ay, A tell ye, an faur mair ner a proaphit.

first: Tha wee lass ïs no deid, she's jist sleepin.” But the' begun tae lach at hïm.

first: Eftèr tha crood wus püt oot tha dure, Jesus gaed ïn an tuk tha wee lass bi tha han, an she ris tae hir feet.

first: An thïs wus aa tha taak o that hale kintrieside.

first: Twa blin men  As Jesus gaed on frae thair, twa blin men follaed hïm, caain oot, “Sinn o Davit, tak peetie on iz!” Whaniver he went ïntae hïs hoose, tha blin men cum ïn tae, an he axt thaim, “Dae yis believe A hae tha pooer fer tae dae whut ye'r wantin?” “Ay, Loard,” the' saed, “we dae.” Then he toucht thair een an saed, “It'll be daen tae ye, accoardin tae yer faith.” An thair sicht cum bak, an the' cud see!

second: Ye ir laik white-waashed graves, that luk quare an nice on tha ootside but on tha inside the'r fu o deid men's banes an iveriethin that's no clain.

first: An Jesus driv oot tha ïll spïrit, sae tha man that wus dum cud noo spake.
second: Micht yer Kïngdom cum shuin,  An yer wull be daen on irth  Jist tha wye ït ïs Abain.

first: Tha crood o fowk wus dumfoonèrt an saed, “We niver saen tha laiks o thïs ïn Israel afore!” But tha Pharisees saed, “It's tha Deil, tha heidyin o tha ïll spïrits that gies hïm tha pooer tae cast oot ïll spïrits!”  A gran hairst ïs waitin  An Jesus trevelt throu aa tha toons an vïllages, taichin ïn thair Meetin Hooses, praichin tha Guid News o tha Kïngdom, an hailin iverie kine o disaise an ailment.
second: But whan he heerd that Archelaus wus tha Kïng o Judea ïn tha ruim o hïs faither Herod, he wus feart tae gae thair.

second: Tha nerra gate  Gae ïn bi tha nerra gate.

second: Dïnnae judge ithers  “Dïnnae judge ithers, sae as ye'll no be judged yersels.

second: Treysures ïn heiven  Dïnnae hoord up fer yersels treysures on irth, whar moths an roost desthroy, an whar thiefs brek ïn an steal.

first: Tha names o tha twal possels wus: furst, Simon  an hïs brither Andra; then Jeames tha sinn o Zebedee, an hïs brither Jhone; Phïlip an Bartholomew; Tammas an Mattha tha tex man; Jeames tha sinn o Alphaeus, an Thaddaeus; Simon tha Zealot an Judas Iscariot, tha yin that bethrayed Jesus.
second: Tha Sinn o Man ïs bethrayed ïntae tha hans o wrangdaers.

second: But wile sorra tae tha yin that bethrays hïm!

first: But rether gae tae tha loast sheep o Israel.

first: An as ye ir gaun alang, praich thïs: ‘Tha Kïngdom o Heiven ïs nearhan.’ Heal seeck fowk, rise tha deid, cleanse thaim wi leprosie, drive oot ïll spïrits.
second: Up tae seiven times?” Jesus saed bak tae hïm, “A tell ye, no seiven times, but mair laik seiventie times seiven .

first: Ye hae freelie received, sae ye maun gie freelie.
second: A tell yin tae gang an he gangs, an anither yin tae cum, an he cums.

first: Dïnnae tak alang onie gowld or siller, ner e'en a copper ïn yer girthpooch; tak nae baag fer tha róad, ner spare claes, ner shune ner a stav; fer tha warker ïs warth hïs keep.
second: Fer fauss messiahs an fauss proaphits wull rise up an dae michtie signs an wunnèrs; an fowk wull be tuk ïn bi thaim, ay, an ïf the'r able, the' wull fool even tha chosen yins as weel.

first: Whutiver toon or vïllage ye gae ïntae, luk fer some warthie dacent bodie thair an stap ower at hïs hoose til ye tak yer lave o tha place.

first: As ye gae ïntae thïs hame or that, bïd thaim tha time o day.

first: If tha hame ïs warthie, let yer blissin be on ït; ïf ït ïsnae warthie, let yer blissin cum bak tae ye.

first: If the' dïnnae mak yis walcum or gie yis a hearin, dicht tha stour aff yer feet whan ye lea that hame or toon.

first: A tell ye tha truith, tha fowk o Sodom an Gomorrah wull be bettèr aff on tha Day o Reckonin ner that toon.
second: Agane, A tell ye that ïf twa o ye here on irth agree aboot oniethin ye ax fer, ït'll be daen fer ye bi ma Faither ïn heiven.

first: A'm sennin yis oot laik sheep amang wolfs.

first: Sae be as cannie as sarpents an as hairmless as doos.

first: Be on yer gaird agin men; the'll han yis ower tae tha cooncils an gie yis a guid whuppin ïn thair Meetin Hooses.

first: On accoont o me, ye'll be brocht afore guviners an kïngs as wutnesses tae thaim an tae tha Gentiles.
second: An eftèr the' wur cairriet awa tae Babylon, Jeconiah becum tha faither o Shealtiel, an Shealtiel tha faither o Zerubbabel.

first: But whaniver yis ir lïftit an brocht tae thrial, dïnnae be ower enxious aboot whut tae say or hoo tae say ït.
second: Walth ïn heiven  Noo, alang cum thïs man tae Jesus an axt hïm, “Maistèr, whut guid thïng maun A dae tae hae iverlastin life?” “Whut dae ye main bi ‘guid’?” Jesus saed.

first: Ye'll be gien tha richt wurds at tha richt time.
second: Aboot adultèrie  Yis hae heerd that ït wus saed, ‘Dïnnae commït adultèrie.’ But A'm tellin yis that oniebodie that even luks at a wumman wi lust haes aareadie commïtit adultèrie wi hir ïn hïs hairt.

first: Fer ït'll no be you that's spakin, but tha Spïrit o yer Faither spakin throu ye.
second: Wurd aboot hïm spreed aa ower Syria, an the' brocht tae hïm aa tha seeck fowk wi aa kines o disaises: thaim that wus tormentit, or bothert wi ïll spïrits, or tuk fïts, or fowk that wus paralysed, an he made thaim bettèr.

first: Brithers wull han ower thair brithers tae be kïllt, an faithers thair weans; an weans wull rise up agin thair faithers an mithers an hae thaim püt tae deith as weel.
second: Sitch a thrang o fowk gethert roon hïm that he got ïntae a bóat an sut ïn ït, while aa tha fowk stud bye on tha shore.

first: Ye'll be haitit bi yin an aa on accoont o me, but he that tholes tae tha enn wull be saved.
second: Ye'll ken thaim bi thair fruit, ay, bi whut the' dae.

first: Whan yis ir persecutit ïn yin place, fly tae anither.
second: An whaiver walcums yin o these weans ïn ma name walcums me.

first: A tell ye tha truith, ye'll no hae feenished gaun throu aa tha toons o Israel afore tha Sinn o Man cums bak!
second: Sae A'm gaun tae senn ye proaphits, an wise men, an taichers.

first: A follaer ïs no abain hïs taicher, ner a sarvint abain hïs maistèr.

first: Whut mair can tha follaer ax than tae be laik hïs taicher, or tha sarvint tae be laik hïs maistèr?
second: Ye can tell a tree bi its fruit.

first: Gin the' hae caad tha heid o tha hoose Beelzebul, weel, whut wull the' no caa aa tha yins o hïs hoosehold!
second: Noo whaniver Petèr cum ïntae tha hoose, Jesus wus tha furst tae spake oot.

first: Sae dïnnae be afeart o thaim.
second: Dae ït while ye ir still wi hïm on tha wye thair, or he'll mebbe han ye ower tae tha judge, an tha judge cud han ye ower tae tha offysher, an ye cud be cloddit ïntae jail.

first: Thair's naethin covert ower that'll no cum tae licht, ner hïd that'll no be kent.
second: That's hoo ït'll be at tha enn o tha warl.

first: Whut A tell ye ïn tha dairk, spake oot ïn tha braid daylicht; whut's whuspert ïn yer ear, blare ït oot frae tha ruiftaps.
second: Jist tha wye tha weeds ir pu'ed up an brunt ïn tha fire, that's tha wye ït'll be at tha enn o tha warl.

first: Dïnnae be feart o thaim that kïll tha bodie but cannae kïll tha sowl.
second: But tha thïngs that cum oot o tha mooth cum frae tha hairt, an that's whut sullies a bodie.

first: Rether, be afeart o tha Yin that can desthroy baith bodie an sowl ïn hell.
second: Maistèr,’ he saed, ‘ye hannit ower five baags tae me.

first: Ir twa wee sparras no soul fer a pennie?
second: If he lïstens tae ye, ye hae wun yer brither ower.

first: Yit no yin o thaim wull faa tae tha grun wioot yer Faither knowin ït.
second: Na, A dïdnae cum tae brïng peace, but a sword.

first: Fer tha verie hairs o yer heid ir aa coontit.
second: Ay, Faither, ït haes plaised ye tae dae ït thïs wye.

first: Sae dïnnae be feart; yis ir warth mair ner a hale wheen o sparras.
second: Fer saed she til hirsel, “If A can jist touch hïs cloke, A wull be made weel agane.” Jesus turnt roon an saen hir.

first: Whaiver's no feart tae own me afore men, A wull own hïm tae afore ma Faither ïn heiven.
second: Yer follaers ir daein whut's agin tha Laa on tha Sabbath day!” He saed bak tae thaim, “Hae ye no read whut Davit daen whaniver hïm an hïs freens wus hung'rie?

first: But whaiver disowns me afore men, A wull disown hïm afore ma Faither ïn heiven.
second: Monie seeck fowk cured  Noo whaniver Jesus cum ïntae Petèr's hoose, he saen Petèr's mither-ïn-laa lyin ïn bed wi a faivir.

first: Dïnnae be thïnkin A hae cum tae brïng peace tae tha irth.
second: A tell ye that oniebodie that pits awa hïs wife, fer ocht ither ner rinnin aff wi anither man, an then merries anither wumman - that man commïts adultèrie.”  Hïs follaers saed tae hïm, “If that's tha wye o ït wi a man that haes a wife, shair ït wud be faur bettèr no tae merrie ava!” Jesus saed, “It's no iveriebodie can hannle that, jist thaim that's halpt bi God.

first: Na, A dïdnae cum tae brïng peace, but a sword.
second: But tha ithers saed, “Jist lea hïm alane.

first: Fer A hae cum tae turn a man agin hïs faither, a dochtèr agin hir mither, a dochtèr-ïn-laa agin hir mither-ïn-laa; ït'll be tha yins leevin wi a man that wull be agin hïm.
second: Ye can tell a tree bi its fruit.

first: Oniebodie that loves hïs faither or hïs mither mair ner me ïs no warthie o me; nether ïs tha yin that loves hïs sinn or hïs dochtèr mair ner me warthie o me.
second: Whaiver fins hïs life wull loass ït, an whaiver loasses hïs life on accoont o me wull fin ït.

first: An oniebodie that daesnae tak up hïs cross an follae me ïs no warthie o me.
second: An takkin tha five bannocks an tha twa fïsh an lukkin up tae heiven, he blisst ït an brauk tha bannocks.

first: Whaiver fins hïs life wull loass ït, an whaiver loasses hïs life on accoont o me wull fin ït.
second: An he saed, “A tell ye tha truith, ïf ye dïnnae change yer hale wye o gaun an becum laik wee childèr, ye'll niver git ïntae tha Kïngdom o Heiven.

first: Hïm that walcums you walcums me, an hïm that walcums me walcums tha Yin that sent me.
second: Dae yis no mine tha five loafs A gien til tha five thoosan, an aa tha baskets o leains yis gethert up eftèr?

first: Oniebodie that maks a proaphit walcum on accoont o hïs bein a proaphit wull be gien a proaphit's reward, an oniebodie that maks a guid man walcum on accoont o bein a guid man wull git a guid man's reward.
second: Awa an shut up tha tomb as weel as ye can.” Sae the' gaed an made tha tomb safe bi sealin tha stane an leain tha gaird tae keep watch.

first: Jesus an Jhone tha Baptiser  Eftèr Jesus haed daen giein oardèrs tae hïs twal follaers, he gaed on frae thair tae taich an praich ïn tha toons roon aboot.
second: But tha Pharisees gaed oot an the' collogued thegither hoo the' cud dae awa wi Jesus.

first: Noo Jhone wus ïn jail, an whaniver he heerd whut Christ wus daein, he sent [twa o] hïs follaers an the' axt hïm, “Ir you tha Yin that wus supposed tae cum, or shud we be lukkin oot fer some ither bodie?” Jesus toul thaim, “Gae bak an gie Jhone an accoont o whut ye hear an see.
second: Tha hailin o aa kines o fowk  Jesus quït thaim pairts an cum tae tha loch shore o Galilee.

first: Blin fowk can see noo, lameters can waak, fowk wi leprosie ir made weel.
second: Whaiver's no feart tae own me afore men, A wull own hïm tae afore ma Faither ïn heiven.

first: Deef fowk can hear.
second: Tha graves apent, an tha bodies o monie halie fowk that haed deed wur ris tae life.

first: Tha deid leeve agane.
second: Wus ït frae heiven, or wus ït jist a notion o man?” The' stairtit tae taak aboot ït amang thairsels an the' saed, “If we say, ‘Frae heiven,’ he'll ax iz, ‘Sae hoo cum yis dïdnae believe hïm?’ But ïf we say, ‘Frae men,’ then we hae tha fowk tae reckon wi, fer the' aa houl that Jhone wus a proaphit.” Sae the' saed bak tae Jesus, “We cannae tell.” An Jesus saed, “Then A'll no be tellin yis ether bi whut thortie A dae these thïngs!”  Tha parable o tha twa sinns  “Whut dae ye thïnk aboot thïs?

first: An tha Guid News ïs praicht tae tha puir.
second: If ye dae, the' may thramp thaim unnèr thair feet, an then turn an teer ye tae bïts.

first: An blisst ïs tha yin that daesnae misdoot me.”  As Jhone's follaers wur leain, Jesus stairtit tae taak tae tha croods aboot hïm: “Whut dïd yis gang oot ïntae tha wuldèrness fer tae see?
second: Five o thaim wus wutless, an five o thaim wus wise.

first: Wus ït tae see tha rushes sweein ïn tha wun?
second: Lea thaim alane!

first: If no, whut dïd ye thïnk ye wud see oot thair?
second: Solomon wus tha faither o Rehoboam, Rehoboam tha faither o Abijah, Abijah tha faither o Asa, Asa tha faither o Jehoshaphat, Jehoshaphat tha faither o Jehoram, Jehoram tha faither o Uzziah.

first: A man aa rigged oot ïn fancie claes?
second: Then the' sut doon an the' waaled throu ït.

first: Na, tha yins ïn fancie claes, ït's ïn kïngs' palaces ye wull fin them.
second: Wus ït a proaphit?

first: Sae whut dïd yis gae oot fer tae see?
second: Tha Loard hissel haes wrocht thïs,  An a wunnèrfu sicht ït ïs!’  Sae A tell ye that tha Kïngdom o God wull be tuk awa frae ye an be gien tae a nation that wull produce tha fruit ït shud.

first: Wus ït a proaphit?
second: Micht yer Kïngdom cum shuin,  An yer wull be daen on irth  Jist tha wye ït ïs Abain.

first: Ay, A tell ye, an faur mair ner a proaphit.
second: But jist say tha wurd, an ma sarvin man wull be bettèr agane.

first: Thïs ïs tha yin tha Scrïptures taak aboot whan the' say:  ‘Lïsten, A wull senn oot ma messenger aheid o ye;  he wull mak readie tha wye afore ye.’  A tell ye tha truith: amangst thaim boarn o a wumman, naebodie haes iver leeved that's mair impoartin ner Jhone tha Baptiser; yit tha yin that ïs laist ïn tha Kïngdom o Heiven ïs a bettèr man ner hïm.
second: Tha croods walcum Jesus tae Jerusalem  Whaniver the' wur nearhan Jerusalem an the' cum tae Bethphage on tha Moont o Olives, Jesus sent oot twa follaers, an he saed tae thaim, “Gae tae tha clachan fornent ye, an at yinst ye'll fin a cuddie tethèrt thair, wi hir cowlt alangside o hir.

first: Frae tha time Jhone tha Baptiser stairtit tae praich up til noo, fowk ir tryin tae püsh thair wye ïntae tha Kïngdom o Heiven, an violent men ir takkin houl o ït.
second: Or tha seiven loafs A gie til tha fower thoosan, an hoo monie creels yis gethert up anaa?

first: Fer up tae Jhone's time, aa tha proaphits an tha Laa foretoul whut wus tae happen.
second: Iverie tree that daesnae gie guid fruit ïs cut doon an throwed ïntae tha fire.

first: An ïf ye ir wullin tae believe whut A say, Jhone ïs tha Elijah that wus tae cum.
second: Be joyfu an gled, acause yis hae a pooerfu reward waitin fer ye ïn heiven, fer the' ïll-traitit tha proaphits that wus thair afore ye ïn jist tha same wye.

first: Let hïm that haes ears ïn hïs heid tak tent!
second: In thïs wye tha wurd spauk bi Jeremiah tha proaphit cum aboot: “The' tuk tha thurtie siller coins, tha amoont pit on hïs heid bi Israel, an the' uised thaim tae buy tha potter's fiel, jist as tha Loard commaundit.”  Jesus up afore Pilate  While aa thïs wus gaun on, Jesus stud afore tha Guviner, an tha Guviner axt hïm, “Ir you tha Kïng o tha Jews?” Jesus answert, “You hae saed ït.” But whaniver he wus accused bi tha heid preeshts an tha eldèrs, he gien nae answer ava.

first: Whut can A say aboot tha fowk noo-a-days?
second: Awa tae thaim that sells tha oiyle an buy some fer yersels!’ But while the' wur on thair wye fer tae buy tha oiyle, here dïdnae tha bridegruim turn up!

first: The' ir laik weans sïttin doon at tha mairket an caain oot tae tha ithers,  ‘We played tha whustle fer ye, an ye wudnae daunce;  we sung a dirge tae ye, an ye wudnae greet.’  Fer Jhone wusnae ïntae aitin ner drïnkin whan he cum, an the' say, ‘Thair's a baad spïrit ïn hïm.’ Yit tha Sinn o Man cum aitin an drïnkin, an the' say, ‘Wud ye luk at hïm, he's a glutton, an he's tarrible fand o tha drïnk sae he ïs - tha freen o tex men an wrangdaers!’ But daein whut's richt proves tha wusdom o God's wyes.”  Sartin cïties tuk tae task  Then Jesus stairtit tae tak tae task tha cïties whar he haed daen tha maist o hïs mïracles, acause the' dïdnae repent.
second: He gaed ïntae tha Hoose o God, an hïm an hïs freens et tha halie showbreid.

first: Sorra tae Chorazim, an sorra tae Bethsaida, fer ïf tha fowk o Tyre an Sidon haed saen tha warkin o God's pooer as yous hae saen ït, the' wud hae repentit lang syne ïn seckclaith an eshes.
second: A wull gie ye tha keys o tha Kïngdom o Heiven; an whutiver ye bine on irth wull be bun ïn heiven, an whutiver ye lowse on irth wull be lowsed ïn heiven.” Then he bïd hïs follaers no tae tell oniebodie that he wus tha Christ.

first: But A'm tellin ye, tha fowk o Tyre an Sidon wull be bettèr aff on tha Day o Reckonin than yous wull.
second: Wae faa ye, maistèrs o tha Laa an Pharisees, ye hippycrates!

first: An Capernaum, you micht thïnk ye'r weel on yer wye tae heiven.
second: Sae whaniver ye see ‘tha abomination o desolation’ stannin ïn tha halie place - tha abomination tha proaphit Daniel spauk aboot,” (Reader, ye'll unnèrstan ma mainin here) “then thaim at's ïn Judea maun tak tae tha hïlls.

first: Na, but A'm tellin ye, ye'll be brocht doon tae hell!
second: Then Jesus saed tae thaim, “Dïnnae be feart.

first: Fer ïf tha mïracles that wus daen ïn you haed bin daen ïn Sodom, ït wud be thair tae thïs day.
second: Tha men wur dumfoonèrt an axt, “Whut kine o a man ïs thïs?

first: But A tell ye that Sodom wull be bettèr aff on tha day o Reckonin ner you.”  Ma yauk ïs aisie  At that time Jesus saed, “Faither, Loard o heiven an irth, A praise ye that ye hae kep these thïngs frae clivir an warlie-wise fowk, an made thaim clear eneuch fer weans tae unnèrstan.
second: Bide thair til A gie ye tha wurd, fer Herod ïs aboot tae hunt oot tha wean fer tae dae awa wi hïm.” Sae up Joseph got, he tuk tha wean an hïs mither wi hïm ïn tha mïddle o tha nicht, an he set aff fer Egypt.

first: Ay, Faither, ït haes plaised ye tae dae ït thïs wye.
second: Or dae ye begrudge me bein guid tae tha ithers?’ Sae tha last wull be foremaist,” saed Jesus, “an tha foremaist wull be last.

first: Ma Faither haes gien aa thïngs ower tae me, an naebodie unnèrstans tha Sinn apairt frae tha Faither, an naebodie unnèrstans tha Faither apairt frae tha Sinn, an whaiver tha Sinn wants tae reveal hïm tae.
second: An tha angels wull flïng thaim ïntae tha fierie furnace, whar thair wull be sair greetin an scringein o teeth.

first: Cum tae me, aa you that's wearie an burdent, an A wull gie ye rest.
second: Tha Han-waaled sarvint  Jesus, knowin thïs, left that place.

first: Tak ma yauk upon ye an lairn frae me, fer A'm gentle an hummle ïn hairt, an yis'll fin rest fer yer sowls.
second: An tha yin that sweers bi heiven sweers bi God's throne, an bi tha Yin that sïts on tha throne.

first: Loard o tha Sabbath  At that time Jesus gaed throu tha coarnfiels on tha Sabbath day.
second: Then the' went an toul Jesus whut haed happent.

first: Hïs follaers wur hung'rie got, an the' begun tae pluck tha heids aff tha coarn an the' et thaim.
second: If no, whut dïd ye thïnk ye wud see oot thair?

first: Whaniver tha Pharisees saen thïs, the' saed tae hïm, “Luk!
second: Oniebodie that maks a proaphit walcum on accoont o hïs bein a proaphit wull be gien a proaphit's reward, an oniebodie that maks a guid man walcum on accoont o bein a guid man wull git a guid man's reward.

first: Yer follaers ir daein whut's agin tha Laa on tha Sabbath day!” He saed bak tae thaim, “Hae ye no read whut Davit daen whaniver hïm an hïs freens wus hung'rie?
second: A wull gie ye tha keys o tha Kïngdom o Heiven; an whutiver ye bine on irth wull be bun ïn heiven, an whutiver ye lowse on irth wull be lowsed ïn heiven.” Then he bïd hïs follaers no tae tell oniebodie that he wus tha Christ.

first: He gaed ïntae tha Hoose o God, an hïm an hïs freens et tha halie showbreid.
second: An that's tha raison tae thïs verie day ït's caad “Tha Fiel o Bluid”.

first: An thair wus naebodie barrin tha preeshts allooed tae dae thïs.
second: Noo Judas, that haed bethrayed hïm, whaniver he saa that Jesus wus condemned, he sairlie rued whut he'd daen, an he gien tha thurtie siller coins bak tae tha heid preeshts an tha eldèrs.

first: Or hae ye no read ïn tha Laa that tha preeshts ïn tha Hoose o God ir allooed tae wark on tha Sabbath Day, an yit the'ir no hel tae accoont fer brekkin tha Laa?
second: Pray tae God that ye dïnnae hae tae flee ïn tha wuntèr or on tha Sabbath.

first: A tell ye, we'r taakin aboot sumthin mair impoartin ner tha Hoose o God here.
second: Sae dïnnae fash yersels aboot themorra, fer themorra wull luk eftèr ïtsel.

first: Tha Scrïpture says: ‘It's mercie A'm eftèr, A'm no eftèr secryfice’, an ïf ye haed unnèrstud tha mainin o these wurds, ye wudnae hae saed that ma follaers wus sïnners whan the' ir no!
second: Whariver ye see a crood o vultèrs, ye know thair's a deid bodie thair.

first: Fer tha Sinn o Man ïs Loard o tha Sabbath anaa.”  Jesus hails on tha Sabbath day  Jesus gaed on frae that place, an he gaed ïntae thair Meetin Hoose.
second: That wus roon aboot tha time the' wur cairriet aff tae Babylon.

first: An thair wus a man thair an hïs richt han wus wuthert.
second: A guid man brïngs guid thïngs oot o tha guidness stored ïn hïs hairt; a wïckit man brïngs wïckit thïngs oot o hïs store o wïckitness.

first: Lukkin tae hae sumthin agin Jesus, tha Pharisees axt hïm, “Ir ye allooed tae hail on tha Sabbath day?” Jesus saed bak tae thaim, “If onie o yis haes a sheep an ït faas ïntae a sheuch on tha Sabbath, wud ye no tak houl o ït an pu ït oot?
second: But A'm tellin ye, tha fowk o Tyre an Sidon wull be bettèr aff on tha Day o Reckonin than yous wull.

first: Is a man no warth faur mair ner a sheep?
second: Blisst ir tha yins that ir gentle, fer the' wull inherit tha irth.

first: Ay, sae ït's aa richt tae dae guid on tha Sabbath day!” Wi that, he saed tae tha man, “Streetch oot yer han.” Sae he streetcht ït oot an ït wus aa hailt, an jist as guid as tha ither yin.
second: It's masel.

first: But tha Pharisees gaed oot an the' collogued thegither hoo the' cud dae awa wi Jesus.
second: Is life no mair impoartin ner mait, an tha bodie mair impoartin ner claes?

first: Tha Han-waaled sarvint  Jesus, knowin thïs, left that place.
second: Maistèr,” the' saed, “we ken ye spake tha truith, an that ye taich fowk tha wye o God accoardin tae tha truith, wioot onie thocht o whut ither fowk thïnks o ye.

first: An a wile thrang o fowk follaed hïm, an he made aa thair seeck fowk bettèr, an he gien thaim a warnin no tae tell oniebodie wha he wus.
second: You wur wi Jesus o Galilee as weel,” she saed.

first: Thïs wus tae fülfill whut wus spauk aboot hïm throu tha proaphit Isaiah:  “Here ïs ma sarvint, ma Han-waaled Yin;  he's tha yin A love, he's tha yin A'm weel plaised wi;  A'll pit ma Spïrit on hïm,  an he'll tell oot justice tae tha nations.
second: Whutch o tha twa dae yis want me tae let oot tae yis then?” axt tha Guviner.

first: He'll no cum argyin or cryin oot;  nether wull he rise hïs voice ïn tha raas.
second: They nether wark ner spïn!

first: A bent reed he'll no brek aff,  an he'll no snuff oot a smoldèrin wïck,  til he leads justice on tae vïctrie.
second: An jist then thair appeart afore thaim Moses an Elijah, an the' wur taakin wi Jesus.

first: In hïs name tha nations wull pit thair trust.”  Jesus an Beelzebul  Then the' brocht hïm a man bothert wi ïll spïrits.
second: Tha lasses that haed made readie gaed wi hïm ïntae tha waddin pairtie.

first: He wus blin an dum, an Jesus made hïm bettèr, sae he cud baith taak an see.
second: Or hae ye no read ïn tha Laa that tha preeshts ïn tha Hoose o God ir allooed tae wark on tha Sabbath Day, an yit the'ir no hel tae accoont fer brekkin tha Laa?

first: Aa tha fowk wur thunnèrstruck an the' saed, “Cud thïs be tha Sinn o Davit?” But whaniver tha Pharisees heerd thïs, the' saed, “It ïs onlie bi Beelzebul, tha heidyin o tha ïll spïrits, that thïs fella casts oot ïll spïrits.” Knowin thair thochts Jesus saed tae thaim, “Iverie kïngdom divïd agin ïtsel wull gae tae reck an ruin, an iverie cïtie or hoose divïd agin ïtsel wull no stan.
second: Yous gie thaim sumthin tae ait.” “We hae naethin here but five bannocks an twa fïsh,” the' reponed.

first: An ïf Satan casts oot Satan, he ïs divïd agin hissel, an hoo then cud hïs kïngdom stan?
second: But whan ye fast, pit oiyle on yer heid an waash yer face, sae fowk wull no notysh that ye ir fastin; yer Faither but, wha ye cannae see, wull notysh; an tha Yin that sees whut ïs daen ïn hidlins, he wull gie ye yer reward.

first: An ïf A cast oot ïll spïrits bi tha pooer o Beelzebul, bi whut pooer then daes yer ain fowk cast thaim oot?
second: Thïs ïs a guid thïng she haes daen fer me.

first: Sae let thaim be tha yins tae judge ye fer whut ye hae saed.
second: Itherwise the' cud see wi thair een,  the' cud hear wi thair ears,  the' cud unnèrstan wi thair hairts,  an the' wud turn tae me, tae hail thaim.”’  But your een ïs blisst acause they can see, an your ears tae, acause they can hear.

first: But ïf A cast oot ïll spïrits bi tha Spïrit o God, ït proves that tha Kïngdom o God ïs here amang ye.
second: Hïs follaers gethert roon hïm, an he stairtit tae taich thaim, sayin,  Tha Blissins  “Blisst ir tha puir ïn spïrit, fer thairs ïs tha Kïngdom o Heiven.

first: Or agane, hoo can oniebodie git ïntae a strang man's hoose an cairrie aff hïs belangins, less he furst tyes up tha strang man?
second: But rether gae tae tha loast sheep o Israel.

first: Eftèr that, he can plunner awa!
second: An iverie yin that haes gien up hooses, or brithers, or sïstèrs, or faither, or mither, or [wife, or] childèr, or fairm o lan on accoont o me wull git bak a hunnèr times as much; an he wull inherit iverlastin life.

first: Hïm that ïs no for me ïs agin me, an hïm that ïsnae giein me a han tae gether ïn, he micht as weel be scattèrin.
second: A tell ye tha truith, ïf yis hae faith as smaa as a mustèrt seed even, yis'll say tae thïs muntin, ‘Shïft frae here tae thair,’ an ït'll shïft!

first: An sae A tell ye, men wull be forgien iverie sïn an blesphemie, but tha blesphemie agin tha Spïrit wull no be forgien.
second: Fer saed she til hirsel, “If A can jist touch hïs cloke, A wull be made weel agane.” Jesus turnt roon an saen hir.

first: Oniebodie that spakes a wurd agin tha Sinn o Man wull be forgien, but oniebodie that spakes agin tha Halie Spïrit wull no be forgien, nether ïn thïs age ner ïn tha age tae cum.
second: Thaim at waakt bye yellt abuse at hïm, shakin thair heids, an sayin, “Hey, you that saed ye wur gaun tae desthroy tha Hoose o God, an big ït agane ïn thrie days - save yersel!

first: Ye can tell a tree bi its fruit.

first: Gin tha tree's guid, ïts fruit wull be guid; gin ït's baad ïts fruit wull be baad.
second: Jist let yer ‘Ay’ be ‘Ay’, an yer ‘Na’, ‘Na’; oniethin mair ner thïs cums frae tha wïckit yin.

first: Ye sleekit shooer o vipers, hoo can ye say ocht that's guid whan ye'r wïckit yersels?

first: Fer whut's ïn yer hairt wull cum oot o yer mooth.

first: A guid man brïngs guid thïngs oot o tha guidness stored ïn hïs hairt; a wïckit man brïngs wïckit thïngs oot o hïs store o wïckitness.

first: But A tell ye, on tha Day o Reckonin men wull hae tae mak answer fer iverie careless wurd the' hae spauk.

first: Fer bi yer wurds ye'll be judged no guiltie, an bi yer wurds ye'll be condemned.”  Tha sign o Jonah  Then some o tha Pharisees an maistèrs o tha Laa saed tae hïm, “Maistèr, we want a mïraclis sign frae ye!” He saed bak tae thaim, “It's onlie a wïckit an adultèrous genèration wud luk fer a mïraclis sign!
second: Gang tae tha cross-róads an ax oniebodie ye fin tae cum tae tha waddin!’ Sae tha sarvints gan oot ïntae tha raas an the' gethert aa tha fowk the' cud fin, baith saint an sïnner, til tha waddin haal wus fu o guests.

first: But thair'll be nane gien apairt frae tha sign o tha proaphit Jonah.

first: Fer jist as Jonah wus thrie days an thrie nichts ïn tha belly o a bïg fïsh, ïn tha same wye tha Sinn o Man wull be thrie days an thrie nichts ïn tha hairt o tha irth.
second: Luk at tha burds o tha air; the' dïnnae sow ner reap ner hoord awa ïn barns, an yit yer heivenlie Faither feeds thaim.

first: Tha men o Nineveh wull stan up at tha Day o Reckonin wi thïs genèration an the'll condemn ït; fer they repentit whaniver Jonah praicht tae thaim, an yit tha yin that's here noo ïs mair ner onie Jonah.
second: At that time a hale lock o fowk wull turn awa frae tha faith, an the'll bethray an hait yin anither.

second: Be clain!” An richt awa he wus cured o hïs leprosie.

first: But ït fins nane.

first: An that man enns up faur waur ner he wus afore.

first: Summodie toul hïm, “Yer mither an yer brithers ir waitin ootbye, lukkin tae spake tae ye.” But Jesus cum bak wi thïs, “Wha ïs ma mither, an wha ir ma brithers?” Pointin tae hïs follaers, he saed, “Luk, thair's ma mither an ma brithers!

first: Sitch a thrang o fowk gethert roon hïm that he got ïntae a bóat an sut ïn ït, while aa tha fowk stud bye on tha shore.

first: An as he wus scattèrin ït, some drapt doon alang tha pad, an tha burds flew doon an peckt thaim up.

first: Thair wus some seed faad doon on roakie grun, whar thair wusnae much clye.

first: Ither seed faad doon amang thoarns an breers, that sprung up, tuk ower an chokt ït.

second: She wull hae a sinn, an ye ir tae gie hïm tha name Jesus, fer he wull save hïs ain fowk frae thair wrangdaeins.” Noo aa thïs wus daen tae brïng aboot whut tha Loard haed saed throu tha proaphit:  “A virgin wull cairrie a wean, a sinn,  an whan he's boarn, he'll be caad Immanuel”  - mainin “God ïs wi iz.”  Whaniver Joseph waakent up, he daen whut tha angel o tha Loard haed toul hïm tae dae, an he tuk Mary hame fer tae be hïs wife.

second: Cum tae me, aa you that's wearie an burdent, an A wull gie ye rest.

first: Lïsten then tae whut tha parable o tha sower mains: Whan oniebodie hears tha message aboot tha Kïngdom an daesnae unnèrstan ït, alang cums tha Wïckit Yin an snaps awa whut wus sowed ïn hïs hairt.
second: An oniebodie that says, ‘Ye oul fool!’ wull be rinnin tha risk o hell fire.

first: Thïs ïs whut tha seed sowed nixt tha pad stans fer.

first: An then tha seed that faad on roakie grun stans fer tha bodie that hears tha message, an taks ït ïn richt awa wi a gled hairt.

first: But seein as he haes nae ruits, ït onlie houls wi hïm fer a wee while.

second: Thaim at waakt bye yellt abuse at hïm, shakin thair heids, an sayin, “Hey, you that saed ye wur gaun tae desthroy tha Hoose o God, an big ït agane ïn thrie days - save yersel!

first: Noo as shune as tha wheat brairdit an tha ears appeart, tha weeds cum up as weel.

first: An tha fairmer's sarvin men cum up tae hïm.

first: Maistèr,’ the' saed, ‘dïd ye no sow guid seed ïn yer fiel?

first: Whar then dïd tha weeds cum frae?’ ‘An enemie haes daen thïs,’ he saed.

first: Let thaim baith growe thegither tae tha hairvest.
