second: Tha Queen o tha Sooth wull stan up wi thïs genèration tae be judged as weel on that Day, an she wull condemn ït; fer she cum frae tha enns o tha irth fer tae lïsten tae Solomon's wusdom, an noo yin abain Solomon ïs here, an yis ir no lïstenin!

first: In tha same wye ma Faither ïn heiven ïsnae wullin that onie o these weans shud be loast.
second: Tha Sinn o Man wull senn oot hïs angels, an the'll ruit oot o hïs Kïngdom iveriethin that brïngs aboot sïn an aa thaim that daes wrang.

first: Whut ïf yer brither daes ye wrang?
second: Blin fowk can see noo, lameters can waak, fowk wi leprosie ir made weel.

first: If yer brither daes ye wrang, gae an show hïm hïs sïn, jist atween tha twa o ye.
second: That's hoo ït'll be at tha enn o tha warl.

first: If he lïstens tae ye, ye hae wun yer brither ower.
second: Agane, oniebodie that says tae hïs brither, ‘Ye eejit ye!’ - that bodie wull hae tha Heich Cooncil tae answer tae.

first: But ïf he'll no lïsten, tak yin or twa ithers alang, sae that - as tha Scrïpture says - ‘twarthie wutnesses wull testify tae tha truith o iverie wurd spauk.’ An ïf he wull no lïsten tae thaim, tell ït tae tha kirk; an ïf he wull no lïsten tae tha kirk ether, dail wi hïm tha wye ye wud dae wi a tex man, or tha haithen.
second: Fer whut's ïn yer hairt wull cum oot o yer mooth.

first: A tell ye tha truith, whutiver ye bine on irth wull be bun ïn heiven, an whutiver ye lowse on irth wull be lowsed ïn heiven.
second: Noo tha bethrayer haed warkt oot a sign wi thaim: “Tha yin A kïss ïs tha man ye'r lukkin; tak tha houl o hïm.” Sae Judas gaed strecht up tae Jesus, an he saed, “Greetins, Rabbi!” an he kïsst hïm.

first: Agane, A tell ye that ïf twa o ye here on irth agree aboot oniethin ye ax fer, ït'll be daen fer ye bi ma Faither ïn heiven.
second: He trusts ïn God.

first: Fer whar twa or thrie cum thegither ïn ma name, A'm thair amang thaim.”  Forgie yer brither frae yer hairt  Then Petèr cum tae Jesus an axt, “Loard, hoo monie times am A tae forgie ma brither whan he daes wrang agin me?
second: The' cum oot o thair tombs, an eftèr Jesus wus ris frae tha deid the' went ïntae tha halie cïtie an appeart tae a lock o fowk.

first: Up tae seiven times?” Jesus saed bak tae hïm, “A tell ye, no seiven times, but mair laik seiventie times seiven .
second: Tha heid preeshts gethert up tha coins an saed, “It ïs agin tha Laa tae pit thïs ïntae tha Temple kïst, seein as ït's tha price o bluid.” Sae the' agreed amang thairsels tae uise tha siller fer tae buy tha potter's fiel, as a buryin grun fer strangers.

first: Sae ye see, tha Kïngdom o Heiven ïs laik a kïng that wantit hïs sarvints tae settle thair accoonts wi hïm.
second: Tha kïng wus ragein.

first: An as he stairtit tae dae thïs, a man that owed hïm a foartune wus brocht tae hïm.
second: But hoord up fer yersels treysures ïn heiven, whar nether moth ner roost can desthroy, ner thiefs brek ïn an steal.

first: An becas he wusnae able tae pye, tha maistèr oardèrt that baith hïm an tha wife an tha weans, an aa that he haed shud be soul tae pye bak tha debt.
second: He gan on frae thair, an saen twa ither brithers, Jeames tha sinn o Zebedee an hïs brither Jhone.

first: Tha sarvint faad doon on hïs knees afore hïm.
second: An ïf summodie wants tae sue ye an tak tha shirt aff yer bak, let hïm hae yer tap-cóat as weel.

first: Gie me time,’ he plaidit, ‘an A wull pye bak iveriethin.’ Tha sarvint's maistèr tuk peetie on hïm, wiped oot hïs debt an lut hïm gang free.
second: He gaed tae tha furst yin an saed, ‘Sinn, aff ye gang an wark theday ïn tha vineyaird.’ ‘A wull not,’ he saed, but latèr on he renaiged, an he dïd go.

first: But whaniver that sarvint gaed oot, he cum on yin o hïs fella sarvints that owed hïm twarthie thoosan pun.
second: Ye say, ‘If oniebodie sweers bi tha Hoose o God, ït mains naethin; but ïf oniebodie sweers bi tha gowld o tha Hoose o God, he'll be hel tae hïs oath.’ Ye blin coofs ye!

first: He tuk houl o hïm bi tha throat an saed, ‘You pye me bak whut ye owe me!’ Hïs fella sarvint faad doon on hïs knees an begged hïm, ‘Gie me time, an A wull pye ye bak.’ But he wudnae hear o ït.
second: Thair'll cum a day but, whaniver tha bridegruim wull be tuk awa frae thaim; an ït's then the'll be fastin.

first: Insteed, he gan aff an haed tha man throwed ïntae jail til he cud pye up.
second: Jesus taiches on tha muntin  Noo whaniver he saa tha croods, he gaed up tha muntin an sut doon.

first: Whaniver tha ither sarvints saen whut wus gaun on, the' wur wile annoyt, an the' went an toul thair maistèr iveriethin that happent.
second: The' aa et thair fïll, an hïs follaers gethert up twal creels fu o aa tha wee bïts that wus left ower.

first: Then tha maistèr caad tha sarvint ïn.
second: But ïf A cast oot ïll spïrits bi tha Spïrit o God, ït proves that tha Kïngdom o God ïs here amang ye.

first: You wïckit sarvint,’ he saed, ‘A wiped oot that debt o yers acause ye begged me tae.
second: But ïf oniebodie leads asthray yin o these weans that believes ïn me, ït wud be faur bettèr fer hïm tae hae a mïllstane hung roon hïs neck an tae be droont ïn tha depths o tha sea!

first: Shud ye no hae tuk peetie on yer fella sarvint tha same wye A tuk peetie on you?’ Hïs maistèr wus that ang'rie got, he turnt hïm ower tae tha jailers tae be tortured til he pyed bak aa he owed.
second: Hae yis nae faith ava?

first: Jesus axt aboot divorce  Whaniver Jesus wus daen sayin these thïngs, he left Galilee.
second: An whaniver Jesus saa tha faith the' haed, he saed tae tha paralysed man, “Tak hairt, sinn; yer sïns ïs aa forgien.” At thïs, some o tha maistèrs o tha Laa saed amang thairsels, “That's naethin but blesphemie!” Knowin whut the' wur thïnkin, Jesus saed, “Hoo cum yis hae sitch wïckit thochts ïn yer hairt?

first: He gaed ïntae Judea an crosst ower tha rïver Joardan.
second: A tell ye tha truith, the' hae got aa tha reward the'ir gaun tae get.

first: Bïg croods follaed hïm, an he hailt tha seeck amang thaim.
second: Then they gien thaim tae tha crood.

first: Some Pharisees cum up tae hïm, an tae pit hïm tae tha test the' axt hïm, “Is a man allooed tae pit awa hïs wife fer onie an iverie raison?” “Hae ye no read,” Jesus answert, “that richt frae tha stairt tha Creator ‘made men an he made weemen,’ an that he saed, ‘Fer thïs raison a man wull lea hïs faither an hïs mither an be joint tae hïs wife, an tha twa wull becum as yin’?
second: Sïr!’ the' saed.

first: An noo the' ir nae mair twa seprit fowk, but the' ir yin.
second: Tha Twal sent oot  He caad hïs twal follaers thegither an he gien thaim tha pooer tae drive oot ïll spïrits an tae cure aa kines o disaises an ailments.

first: Sae whut God haes püt thegither, let nae man püll sinnerie.” “Whut fer then,” the' axt hïm, “whut fer dïd Moses say that a man cud gie hïs wife a notysh o divorce an pit hir awa?” Jesus saed, “Moses allooed ye tae divorce yer wifes acause yer hairts wus haird.
second: Dïnnae be feart.” Whaniver the' lukt up, thair wus naebodie thair but Jesus.

first: But thïs wusnae tha wye o ït frae tha stairt.
second: Thair the' raxt wine up tae Jesus, mixt wi gall; but eftèr tastin ït, he wudnae drïnk onie mair.

first: A tell ye that oniebodie that pits awa hïs wife, fer ocht ither ner rinnin aff wi anither man, an then merries anither wumman - that man commïts adultèrie.”  Hïs follaers saed tae hïm, “If that's tha wye o ït wi a man that haes a wife, shair ït wud be faur bettèr no tae merrie ava!” Jesus saed, “It's no iveriebodie can hannle that, jist thaim that's halpt bi God.
second: Aa o a suddent, thair wus a michtie irthquake, fer an angel o tha Loard cum doon frae heiven!

first: Fer some ir eunuchs acause the' wur boarn that wye; ithers wur made that wye bi men; an ithers haes gien up tha chaunce o merriage acause o tha Kïngdom o Heiven.
second: He saed tae thaim, “Weel then, iverie maistèr o tha Laa that haes bin schuiled ïn tha thïngs o tha Kïngdom o Heiven, ïs laik tha guidman o tha hoose that brïngs oot o hïs storeruim treysures baith oul an new.”  Is thïs no tha cairpentèr's sinn?

first: Tha yin that can hannle thïs shud accept ït.”  Jesus blisses tha wee weans  Some weans wur brocht tae Jesus fer hïm tae pit hïs hans on thaim an pray fer thaim.
second: Blisst ir tha yins that ir merciefu, fer the' wull be showed mercie.

first: Hïs follaers scoult tha yins that brocht thaim, but Jesus saed, “Alloo tha weans cum tae me, an dïnnae houl thaim bak, fer tha Kïngdom o Heiven belangs tae tha laiks o thaim.” An eftèr he püt hïs hans on tha weans tae bliss thaim, he gaed on frae thair.
second: But tha ithers saed, “Jist lea hïm alane.

first: Walth ïn heiven  Noo, alang cum thïs man tae Jesus an axt hïm, “Maistèr, whut guid thïng maun A dae tae hae iverlastin life?” “Whut dae ye main bi ‘guid’?” Jesus saed.
second: A wïckit an adultèrous genèration luks fer a mïraclis sign, but nane wull be gien ït apairt frae tha sign o Jonah.” Jesus then left thaim an gaed awa.

first: Thair ïs Yin alane that ïs guid.
second: Fer wide ïs tha gate an braid ïs tha róad that leads tae destruction, an monies a yin gaes that wye.

first: If ït's iverlastin life ye'r wantin, dae whut tha commauns bïds ye!” “Whutch yins?” tha man axt.
second: At mïdnicht tha cry rung oot: ‘Here's tha bridegruim!

first: Jesus saed, “ ‘Dïnnae murdèr’.
second: An that's whut ït'll be laik, whaniver tha Sinn o Man cums bak.

first: Dïnnae commït adultèrie’.
second: A man aa rigged oot ïn fancie claes?

first: Dïnnae tak whut's no yer ain’.
second: Watch an pray sae ye dïnnae gie ïn tae temptation.

first: Dïnnae tell lees aboot ither fowk’.
second: Yit ït's your wull A'm wantin, an no ma ain.” Then he cum bak tae hïs follaers an he fun thaim sleepin.

first: Gie respeck tae yer faither an yer mither’, an ‘Ye maun love yer nighber jist as much as yersel’.” “A hae kep aa these,” tha young man saed.
second: Joseph tuk tha bodie, an he lapt ït ïn a clain lïnen claith, an he layed ït ïn hïs ain new tomb he haed cut oot o tha roak.

first: Whut else dae A hae tae dae?” Jesus saed bak tae hïm, “If ye hae a mine tae be perfait, awa an sell aa ye hae got, an gie ït awa tae tha puir, an ye'll hae walth ïn heiven.
second: A tell ye tha truith, ye'll no hae feenished gaun throu aa tha toons o Israel afore tha Sinn o Man cums bak!

first: Then cum bak, an follae me.” Whaniver tha young man heerd thïs, he wus doon ïn tha mooth an went awa, fer he wus quare an weel-aff.
second: Fer whaiver wants tae save hïs life wull loass ït, but hïm that loasses hïs life on ma accoont wull fin ït.

first: Then Jesus saed tae hïs follaers, “A tell ye tha truith, ït ïs haird fer a bodie that's weel-aff tae git ïntae tha Kïngdom o Heiven.
second: In amang thaim thair wus Mary Magdalene, an Mary tha mither o Jeames an Joses, an thair wus tha mither o Zebedee's sinns.

first: Ay, A'm tellin ye, ït wud be aisier fer a kemel tae gae throu tha ee o a needle ner fer a monied man tae git ïntae tha Kïngdom o God.” Whaniver tha follaers heerd thïs, the' wur stoondit an axt, “Wha ïn aa tha warl can be saved then?” Jesus lukt strecht at thaim an saed, “Wi man thïs ïs no poassible, but wi God aa thïngs ir poassible.” Wi that, Petèr saed bak tae hïm, “Luk, we hae gien up iveriethin tae follae ye!
second: If summodie hïts ye on tha richt cheek, turn tha ither side til hïm forbye.

first: Whut then wull thair be ïn ït fer us?” Jesus saed tae thaim, “A tell ye tha truith, whaniver tha new warl cums aboot, an tha Sinn o Man sïts on hïs throne o glorie, yous that hae follaed me wull sït doon on twal thrones as weel, judgin tha twal clans o Israel.
second: A bent reed he'll no brek aff,  an he'll no snuff oot a smoldèrin wïck,  til he leads justice on tae vïctrie.

first: An iverie yin that haes gien up hooses, or brithers, or sïstèrs, or faither, or mither, or [wife, or] childèr, or fairm o lan on accoont o me wull git bak a hunnèr times as much; an he wull inherit iverlastin life.
second: Thair tha hale luk o hïm wus changed afore thair verie een.

first: Tha parable o tha hired labourers  “Fer tha Kïngdom o Heiven ïs laik a fairmer that gan oot at tha scraich o day tae hire men tae wark ïn hïs vineyaird.
second: Jhone tha Baptiser maks tha wye readie fer Jesus  In thaim days Jhone tha Baptiser cum praichin ïn tha wiles o Judea an sayin, “Turn awa frae yer sïns, fer tha Kïngdom o Heiven ïs nearhan.” Jhone ïs tha yin tha proaphit Isaiah spauk aboot, tellin: “Thair's a voice cryin oot ïn tha wiles, ‘Mak tha wye readie fer tha Loard, mak hïs pads strecht fer hïm!’ ” Jhone's claes wus made o kemel's hair, an he haed a leather belt roon hïs mïddle.

first: He saed he wud pye thaim a siller coin fer tha day an he sent thaim oot ïntae hïs vineyaird.
second: The' lukt fer a wye tae hae hïm arrestit, but the' wur feart o tha thrang, acause tha fowk tuk hïm fer a proaphit.

first: Aboot nine ïn tha moarnin, he gan oot an saen ithers stannin ïn tha mairket place wi naethin tae dae.
second: Azor wus tha faither o Zadok, Zadok tha faither o Akim, an Akim tha faither o Eliud.

first: He toul thaim, ‘Gae an wark ïn ma vineyaird as weel, an A'll pye ye a fair wage.’ Sae awa the' went.
second: Then cum bak, an follae me.” Whaniver tha young man heerd thïs, he wus doon ïn tha mooth an went awa, fer he wus quare an weel-aff.

first: Tha fairmer gan oot an he daen tha same thïng aboot nuin, an then agane at thrie.
second: A tell ye tha truith, tha judgemen fer aa thïs wull faa doon on thïs verie genèration.

first: Roon aboot five ïn tha eftèrnuin he gaed oot an fun still ithers stannin roon ïn tha mairket place.
second: Fer fauss messiahs an fauss proaphits wull rise up an dae michtie signs an wunnèrs; an fowk wull be tuk ïn bi thaim, ay, an ïf the'r able, the' wull fool even tha chosen yins as weel.

first: He axt thaim, ‘Why hae ye bin hangin aboot here aa day lang daein naethin?’ ‘Acause naebodie haes tuk iz on,’ the' saed.
second: Dae ït while ye ir still wi hïm on tha wye thair, or he'll mebbe han ye ower tae tha judge, an tha judge cud han ye ower tae tha offysher, an ye cud be cloddit ïntae jail.

first: He saed tae thaim, ‘Gae awa noo an wark ïn ma vineyaird as weel.’ Cum dailygan, tha fairmer saed tae hïs lansteward, ‘Caa tha warkers an pye thaim thair wages, stairtin wi tha last yins A tuk on an gaun bak tae tha furst.’ Tha warkers that wus hired roon five ïn tha eftèrnuin they cum, an iverie yin o thaim wus gien a siller coin apiece.
second: But Petèr follaed hïm a brave wye behin, richt up tae tha coortyaird o tha Heich Preesht.

first: Sae whan tha yins cum that wus hired furst, the' wur lukkin tae git mair.
second: Blisst ir you whan fowks baadmooth ye, an trait ye ïll, an miscaa ye on accoont o me.

first: But iverie last yin o thaim wus onlie gien a siller coin tha same as tha ithers.
second: Ye cannae sarve baith God an Gowld.

first: Whaniver the' got ït, the' stairtit tae grummle agin tha fairmer.
second: Roon aboot five ïn tha eftèrnuin he gaed oot an fun still ithers stannin roon ïn tha mairket place.

first: Thaim men that wus hired last warkt onlie tha yin oor,’ the' saed, ‘an ye hae traitit thaim tha same as us that haes daen tha maist o tha wark an tholed tha hait o tha day.’ But he saed bak tae yin o thaim, ‘Freen, A'm bein fair eneuch tae ye.
second: Whut ïs ït ye ir eftèr wi us, Sinn o God?” the' guldèrt.

first: Dïd ye no say ye wud wark fer yin siller coin?
second: But dïnnae dae tha same as thaim, fer the' dïnnae prectis whut the' praich.

first: Tak whut's yours an aff ye gang.
second: But whan tha croods got tae know aboot ït, the' follaed hïm on fit frae tha toons.

first: Fer A want tae gie tha man that wus hired last tha same as A gien you.
second: But tha Pharisees gaed oot an the' collogued thegither hoo the' cud dae awa wi Jesus.

first: Dae A no hae tha richt tae dae whut A laik wi ma ain siller?
second: Wae faa ye, maistèrs o tha Laa an Pharisees, ye hippycrates!

first: Or dae ye begrudge me bein guid tae tha ithers?’ Sae tha last wull be foremaist,” saed Jesus, “an tha foremaist wull be last.
second: He gan on frae thair, an saen twa ither brithers, Jeames tha sinn o Zebedee an hïs brither Jhone.

first: Monie fowk ïs caad, but few sing'lt oot.]”  Yinst mair Jesus foretells hïs deith  Noo as Jesus wus on tha róad up tae Jerusalem, he tuk tha twal follaers aside, an he saed tae thaim, “Lïsten here, we'r fer Jerusalem, an tha Sinn o Man wull be bethrayed tae tha heid preeshts an tha maistèrs o tha Laa.
second: Boaz wus tha faither o Obed, an tha mither o Obed wus Ruth.

first: The' wull condemn hïm tae deith, an the'll turn hïm ower tae tha Gentiles fer tae be mockt an whuppt an hung up on a cross.
second: Blin fowk can see noo, lameters can waak, fowk wi leprosie ir made weel.

first: But on tha thurd day he'll rise tae life agane!”  Tha wants o a mither  Then tha mither o Zebedee's sinns cum tae Jesus, an hir twa sinns alang wi hir.
second: At tha risin frae tha deid, thair wull be nae mair merryin; fer whaniver the' dee, fowk wull be laik tha angels [o God] ïn heiven.

first: Faain doon afore hïm, she axt a favour o hïm.
second: Zerubbabel wus tha faither o Abiud, Abiud tha faither o Eliakim, an Eliakim tha faither o Azor.

first: Whut ïs ït ye want?” he axt.
second: Is thïs no jist tha cairpentèr's sinn?

first: She saed, “Wud ye see tae ït that yin o these twa sinns o mine wull sït at yer richt han, an tha tither at yer left han, ïn yer Kïngdom?” “Ye dïnnae ken whut ye'r axin,” Jesus saed tae thaim.
second: She cum up behin hïm an toucht tha enn o hïs cloke.

first: Can you drïnk tha cup o sufferin that A'm gaun tae drïnk, [or can ye be baptised wi tha baptisin that A am tae be baptised wi]?” “Ay, that we can,” the' saed.
second: Thïs ïs ma bluid; ït's a sign o God's new coveynant, an ït's poored oot tae forgie monie thair wrangdaeins.

first: Jesus toul thaim, “Yis'll shairlie drïnk frae ma cup o sufferin, but tae sït at ma richt or ma left han side ïsnae fer me tae say.
second: But thair'll be nane gien apairt frae tha sign o tha proaphit Jonah.

first: Ma Faither haes made thaim places readie fer tha yins he's sing'lt oot.” Whan tha ither ten follaers heerd aboot thïs, the' wur wile ang'rie wi tha twa brithers.
second: Dïd ye no say ye wud wark fer yin siller coin?

first: But Jesus caad thaim thegither an saed, “Ye ken that thaim that rule ower tha Gentiles laird ït ower thair ain fowk, an thair heidyins aye lets thaim know wha's tha boss.
second: A'm tellin ye, jist be on yer gaird agin tha yeast o tha Pharisees an Sadducees.” An then the' unnèrstud that he wus no tellin thaim tae gaird agin tha yeast uised ïn breid, but agin tha taichin o tha Pharisees an Sadducees.

first: Wi you ït's no tae be laik that.
second: Then tha hale toon gaed oot tae meet Jesus.

first: Na, whaiver wants tae be impoartin amang ye maun be yer sarvint, an whaiver wants tae be foremaist amang ye maun be yer slave; jist tha wye tha Sinn o Man dïdnae cum tae be tendit tae, but fer tae sarve ithers, an tae gie up hïs life as a ransom fer monie fowk.”  Tha hailin o tha twa blin men  As Jesus an hïs follaers wur leain Jericho, a bïg crood o fowk follaed hïm.
second: Whut can A say aboot tha fowk noo-a-days?

first: An lo an behoul, sïttin on tha bunker o tha róad, thair wus these twa men that wur blin.
second: A tell ye tha truith, ïf yis hae faith as smaa as a mustèrt seed even, yis'll say tae thïs muntin, ‘Shïft frae here tae thair,’ an ït'll shïft!

first: An whaniver the' heerd Jesus wus passin bye, the' cryed oot, “Loard, Sinn o Davit, tak peetie on iz!” Tha thrang chackt thaim an toul thaim tae be quait, but the' guldèrt aa tha mair, sayin, “Loard, Sinn o Davit, tak peetie on iz!” Whaniver he heerd thaim, Jesus stapt.
second: Tha men o Nineveh wull stan up at tha Day o Reckonin wi thïs genèration an the'll condemn ït; fer they repentit whaniver Jonah praicht tae thaim, an yit tha yin that's here noo ïs mair ner onie Jonah.

first: Then he caad tae thaim, “Whut dae yis want me tae dae fer ye?” “Loard,” the' saed, “we want oor sicht bak.” Hïs hairt went oot tae thaim an he püt hïs hans on thair een.
second: But rether gae tae tha loast sheep o Israel.

first: An at yinst the' got thair sicht bak, an the' follaed eftèr Jesus.
second: Alang wi hïm wus a bïg thrang airmed wi swords an stavs, sent oot frae tha heid preeshts an tha eldèrs o tha fowk.

first: Tha croods walcum Jesus tae Jerusalem  Whaniver the' wur nearhan Jerusalem an the' cum tae Bethphage on tha Moont o Olives, Jesus sent oot twa follaers, an he saed tae thaim, “Gae tae tha clachan fornent ye, an at yinst ye'll fin a cuddie tethèrt thair, wi hir cowlt alangside o hir.
second: Blisst ir tha yins that greet, fer the' wull be comfortit.

first: Lowse tha raip, an brïng thaim tae me.
second: But A'm tellin ye, Elijah haes cum aareadie, an the' dïdnae ken wha he wus, but the' daen tae hïm aa the' wantit.

first: If oniebodie says ocht tae ye, tell hïm ‘tha Loard haes need o thaim’, an he'll senn thaim richt awa.” Thïs cum aboot fer tae fülfill whut wus spauk throu tha proaphit:  “Say tae tha dochtèr o Zion,  ‘Luk see, yer kïng ïs on hïs wye tae ye,  gentle an ridin on a cuddie,  on a cowlt, tha foal o a cuddie.’ ”  Tha follaers gan awa an daen as the' wur bïd.
second: Gie yer tenth, but dïnnae ferget tae be fair an kine tae ithers, as weel.

first: The' brocht tha cuddie an tha cowlt, an the' püt thair claes on thaim fer Jesus tae sït on.
second: But seein as he haes nae ruits, ït onlie houls wi hïm fer a wee while.

first: An thair wus a hale thrang o fowk gethert, tha maist o thaim spreedin thair claes on tha róad, while ithers sneddit brenches aff tha trees, an the' strewed thaim on tha pad fer hïm tae ride ower.
second: An Jacob wus tha faither o Joseph, an Joseph wus merriet tae Mary.

first: Tha croods that gan aheid o hïm an thaim that follaed behin cryed oot, “Hosanna tae tha Sinn o Davit!” “Blisst be tha Yin that cums ïn tha name o tha Loard!” “Hosanna ïn tha heichest heiven!” Whaniver Jesus went ïntae Jerusalem, tha hale cïtie wus ïn a stïr an the' axt, “Wha wud thïs man be?” An tha croods saed bak tae thaim, “Thïs ïs Jesus, tha proaphit frae Nazareth ïn Galilee.”  Reddin oot tha dailers  Jesus went ïntae tha Hoose o God an driv oot aa tha dailers that wus buyin an sellin ïn tha coortyaird.
second: Awa an mak ït up wi yer brither furst; then cum bak an gie yer offerin ïn.

first: He coupt tha tables o tha siller changers an whammelt tha saits o thaim that wus sellin doos.
second: Jesus saed, “Freen, dae whut ye cum here fer.” Then tha men cum forrit, the' tuk houl o Jesus an arrestit hïm.

first: It ïs writ doon,” he saed tae thaim, “that ‘ma hoose wull be caad a hoose o prayer’, but yous ir turnin ït ïntae a den o robbers!”  Tha blin an tha lameters cum tae hïm thair ïn tha Hoose o God, an he made thaim bettèr.
second: Fer whut's ïn yer hairt wull cum oot o yer mooth.

first: But whaniver tha heid preeshts an tha maistèrs o tha Laa saen tha wunnèrfu thïngs he daen, an heerd tha verie weans creein oot ïn tha Temple gruns, “Hosanna tae tha Sinn o Davit!” - weel, the' got wile ang'rie.
second: Gae an tell hïs follaers, ‘He haes ris frae tha deid an he's awa on aheid o ye ïntae Galilee.

first: Dae ye hear whut these weans ir sayin?” the' axt Jesus.
second: Fer ye swallae up weedas' hooses an ye mak lang prayers fer a show; sae yis'll be condemned aa tha mair.] Wae faa ye, maistèrs o tha Laa an Pharisees, ye hippycrates!

first: Ay,” he reponed, “hae yis niver read whut tha Scrïptures say,  ‘Frae oot o tha mooth o childèr an weans  ye hae brocht wurds o praise’?” An Jesus left thaim an he gaed awa oot o tha cïtie tae Bethanie, whar he stapt fer tha nicht.
second: If ye laik, A wull pit up thrie shiltèrs, yin fer you, yin fer Moses an yin fer Elijah.” An he wus still taakin, whaniver a bricht clood cum roon thaim, an a voice frae tha clood saed, “Thïs ïs ma Sinn that A love; wi hïm A'm weel plaised.

first: Tha fïg tree wi nae fruit  At tha scraich o day, as he wus on hïs wye bak tae tha cïtie, he wus hung'rie.
second: Lukkin tae hae sumthin agin Jesus, tha Pharisees axt hïm, “Ir ye allooed tae hail on tha Sabbath day?” Jesus saed bak tae thaim, “If onie o yis haes a sheep an ït faas ïntae a sheuch on tha Sabbath, wud ye no tak houl o ït an pu ït oot?

first: An seein a fïg tree bi tha róad, he gaed up tae ït but fun naethin on ït apairt frae leafs.
second: A tell ye, frae noo on you ir Petèr, an on thïs roak A wull big ma kirk, an aa tha pooers o hell wull no owercum ït.

first: Then he saed tae ït, “May ye niver bair fruit agane!” An at yinst tha tree wuthert up.
second: Thair woarship's nae use ava;  thair taichins ir naethin but man-made rules an regulations.’ ”  Jesus caad tha thrang tae hïm an saed, “Lïsten tae me an unnèrstan whut A'm sayin.

first: An whaniver hïs follaers saen thïs, the' wur dumfoonèrt.
second: Dïnnae judge ithers  “Dïnnae judge ithers, sae as ye'll no be judged yersels.

first: Hoo dïd tha fïg tree weezen up an dee sae quïck?” the' axt.
second: An eftèr the' haed daen mockin hïm, the' tuk tha robe aff hïm, an the' püt hïs ain claes bak on hïm.

first: Jesus saed, “A tell ye tha truith, ïf ye hae faith an ye dïnnae doot, no alane can ye dae whut wus daen tae thon fïg tree, but ye cud even say tae thïs muntin, ‘Be shïftit frae whar ye ir, an cast yersel ïntae tha sea!’ an ït'll be daen.
second: An forgie iz oor debts,  jist as we hae forgien tha yins that's ïn debt tae us.

first: If ye believe, God wull gie ye whut ye ax fer ïn prayer.”  Whar dïd tha thortie o Jesus cum frae?
second: Na, ye pit ït on a stan, whar ït gies licht tae tha hale hoose.

first: Jesus went bak ïntae tha Temple gruns, an while he wus taichin, tha heid preeshts an tha Jewish eldèrs cum up tae hïm.
second: If you ir tha Sinn o God, cum doon aff that cross!” An tha heid preeshts, tha maistèrs o tha Laa an tha eldèrs, the' daen tha same, an the' mockt hïm.

first: Bi whut thortie ir ye daein these thïngs?” the' axt.
second: A guid man brïngs guid thïngs oot o tha guidness stored ïn hïs hairt; a wïckit man brïngs wïckit thïngs oot o hïs store o wïckitness.

first: An wha gien ye tha thortie?” Jesus saed, “A want tae ax ye yin question.
second: In thïs wye tha wurd spauk bi Jeremiah tha proaphit cum aboot: “The' tuk tha thurtie siller coins, tha amoont pit on hïs heid bi Israel, an the' uised thaim tae buy tha potter's fiel, jist as tha Loard commaundit.”  Jesus up afore Pilate  While aa thïs wus gaun on, Jesus stud afore tha Guviner, an tha Guviner axt hïm, “Ir you tha Kïng o tha Jews?” Jesus answert, “You hae saed ït.” But whaniver he wus accused bi tha heid preeshts an tha eldèrs, he gien nae answer ava.

first: If ye gie me an answer, then A'll tell ye bi whut thortie A dae these thïngs.
second: But ïf ye dïnnae forgie fowk thair wrangdaeins, yer Faither wull no forgie you tha wrangs yous hae daen.

first: Jhone's baptisin - whar dïd ït cum frae?
second: The' cum tae a place caad Golgotha (mainin “Tha Place o tha Skull”).

first: Wus ït frae heiven, or wus ït jist a notion o man?” The' stairtit tae taak aboot ït amang thairsels an the' saed, “If we say, ‘Frae heiven,’ he'll ax iz, ‘Sae hoo cum yis dïdnae believe hïm?’ But ïf we say, ‘Frae men,’ then we hae tha fowk tae reckon wi, fer the' aa houl that Jhone wus a proaphit.” Sae the' saed bak tae Jesus, “We cannae tell.” An Jesus saed, “Then A'll no be tellin yis ether bi whut thortie A dae these thïngs!”  Tha parable o tha twa sinns  “Whut dae ye thïnk aboot thïs?
second: But ïf he'll no lïsten, tak yin or twa ithers alang, sae that - as tha Scrïpture says - ‘twarthie wutnesses wull testify tae tha truith o iverie wurd spauk.’ An ïf he wull no lïsten tae thaim, tell ït tae tha kirk; an ïf he wull no lïsten tae tha kirk ether, dail wi hïm tha wye ye wud dae wi a tex man, or tha haithen.

first: Thair wus a man that haed twa sinns.
second: Petèr tuk hïm tae tha yin side an begun tae scoul hïm.

first: He gaed tae tha furst yin an saed, ‘Sinn, aff ye gang an wark theday ïn tha vineyaird.’ ‘A wull not,’ he saed, but latèr on he renaiged, an he dïd go.
second: The' cum oot o thair tombs, an eftèr Jesus wus ris frae tha deid the' went ïntae tha halie cïtie an appeart tae a lock o fowk.

first: Then tha faither gaed tae tha ither sinn an he saed tha same tae hïm.
second: Jhone's baptisin - whar dïd ït cum frae?

first: An he saed bak, ‘A wull, sïr,’ but he niver went.
second: Na, A dïdnae cum tae brïng peace, but a sword.

first: Noo whutch yin o tha twa daen whut hïs faither wantit?” “Tha furst yin,” the' saed.
second: Gie me time,’ he plaidit, ‘an A wull pye bak iveriethin.’ Tha sarvint's maistèr tuk peetie on hïm, wiped oot hïs debt an lut hïm gang free.

first: Jesus reponed, “A tell ye tha truith, tex men an weemen wi a baad name aboot tha toon wull get ïntae tha Kïngdom o God aheid o ye.
second: Na, tha yins ïn fancie claes, ït's ïn kïngs' palaces ye wull fin them.

first: Fer Jhone cum fer tae show ye tha wye o righteousness, an ye dïdnae believe hïm, but tha tex men an tha weemen wi a baad name, they dïd.
second: Noo, lairn thïs lesson frae tha fïg tree.

first: An even eftèr ye saa thïs, ye dïdnae repent an believe hïm.
second: An ïf he fins ït, A tell ye tha truith, he ïs mair gled aboot that yin sheep ner aboot tha ninetie-nine that dïdnae wannèr aff!

first: Tha parable o tha wïckit fairmers  Lïsten tae anither parable.
second: Let hïm that haes ears ïn hïs heid tak tent!

first: Thair wus thïs lanlaird that plantit a vineyaird.
second: Hïs face shone laik tha sin, an hïs claes turnt white as tha licht.

first: He fenced ït aa roon, he dug a winepress ïn ït an bigged a luk-oot tooer.
second: He rowlt a bïg stane agin tha mooth o tha tomb an then he gaed awa.

first: Then he set tha vineyaird tae a wheen o tenant-fairmers tae rin, an gan awa on a thrip tae anither kintrie.
second: An whaniver tha heid preeshts haed gethert thegither wi tha eldèrs, the' collogued amang thairsels, an the' gien tha sodgers a bïg amoont o siller, an the' toul thaim, “Ye'r tae say, ‘Tha follaers o Jesus cum ïn tha nicht an stole hïm awa whan we wur sleepin.’ If tha Guviner hears tell o thïs, we'll taak hïm roon, an keep ye oot o bother.” Sae tha sodgers tuk tha siller an daen as the' wur toul.

first: An whaniver ït wus hairvest time, he sent hïs sarvints tae tha fairmers fer tae collect tha fruit.
second: Gie iz a drap o yer oiyle.’ ‘Na,’ the' answert, ‘fer mebbe thair'll no be eneuch fer iz aa.

first: Tha fairmers tuk houl o hïs sarvints; the' bate yin o thaim, the' püt anither tae deith, an the' staned a thurd.
second: Keep on prayin  Keep on axin, an ït wull be gien tae ye, keep on lukkin an ye'll fin whut ye'r eftèr, keep on rappin an tha dure wull be apent tae ye.

first: Then he sent ither sarvints tae thaim, mair ner he sent tha furst time, an tha fairmers traitit thaim aa tha same wye.
second: But whaiver disowns me afore men, A wull disown hïm afore ma Faither ïn heiven.

first: Last o aa, he sent hïs ain sinn tae thaim.
second: Brithers wull han ower thair brithers tae be kïllt, an faithers thair weans; an weans wull rise up agin thair faithers an mithers an hae thaim püt tae deith as weel.

first: He's ma ain sinn, shairlie the'll hae regaird fer hïm!’ he saed.
second: An Jesus driv oot tha ïll spïrit, sae tha man that wus dum cud noo spake.

first: But whaniver tha tenant-fairmers saa tha sinn, the' saed tae yin anither, ‘Thïs ïs tha boy wull tak ower whan hïs da dees.
second: An why dae ye see tha skelf ïn yer brither's ee, but ye dïnnae see tha plenk ïn yer ain ee?

first: Cum on noo, an we'll dae hïm ïn, an whutiver hïs da wus fer leain hïm wull cum tae us!’ Sae the' tuk houl o hïm an throwed hïm oot o tha vineyaird an püt hïm tae deith.”  “Weel noo,” saed Jesus, “whaniver tha laird o tha vineyaird cums, whut wull he dae tae thaim fairmers?”  “He wull brïng thaim wïckit fairmers tae a tarrible enn,” the' answert, “an he'll set tha vineyaird tae ithers, that wull gie hïm hïs share o tha crap at hairvest time.”  Jesus axt thaim, “Hae yis niver read ïn tha Scrïptures:  ‘Tha verie stane tha masons turnt doon  ïs noo tha coarner stane.
second: Tha ten lasses wi thair lamps  “Then tha Kïngdom o Heiven wull be laik ten lasses that tuk thair lamps an gaed oot fer tae meet tha bridegruim.

first: Tha Loard hissel haes wrocht thïs,  An a wunnèrfu sicht ït ïs!’  Sae A tell ye that tha Kïngdom o God wull be tuk awa frae ye an be gien tae a nation that wull produce tha fruit ït shud.
second: If ye jist love thaim at loves you, whut reward wull ye get?

first: Hïm that faas ower thïs stane wull be smesht tae bïts, an whaiver ït faas on wull be grun tae poodèr.]”  Whan tha heid preeshts an tha Pharisees heerd Jesus' parables, the' knowed richtlie he wus gettin at thaim.
second: Tha yins lukkin eftèr tha pïgs run aff; the' gaed ïntae tha toon an toul iveriebodie aa that haed tuk place, an whut haed happent tae tha men bothert wi ïll spïrits.

first: The' lukt fer a wye tae hae hïm arrestit, but the' wur feart o tha thrang, acause tha fowk tuk hïm fer a proaphit.
second: An that year the' haed a prisner iveriebodie haed heerd tell o, bi tha name o Barabbas.

first: Tha waddin pairtie  Jesus spauk tae thaim agane ïn parables, sayin, “Tha Kïngdom o Heiven ïs laik a kïng that got a waddin pairtie readie fer hïs sinn.
second: Hïs follaers cum an waakent hïm, sayin, “Loard, save iz, or we'll aa be droont!” “Hoo cum yis ir sae feart?” saed he.

first: He sent hïs sarvints tae tha yins that wus axt tae tha pairtie tae tell thaim tae cum - but the' wudnae cum.
second: Then he saed tae thaim, “Ma hairt's brekkin wi ang'uish, near tae deith.

first: Wi that he sent some mair sarvints.
second: Ye hae freelie received, sae ye maun gie freelie.

first: Tell thaim that haes bin axt,’ he saed, ‘that tha spreed's aa readie.
second: Ir yous no warth faur mair ner thaim?

first: Ma oxen an ma best fattened kwye haes bin kïllt, an iveriethin ïs readie.
second: An tha ïll spïrits plaidit wi Jesus, “Gin ye ir gaun tae drive iz oot, jist senn iz ïntae tha herd o pïgs thonner.” He saed tae thaim, “Awa wi ye!” Sae the' cum oot o tha men, an gaed ïntae tha pïgs, an aa tha herd tuk aff doon tha hïll, heid furst ïntae tha loch, an tha hale lock o thaim deed ïn tha wattèr.

first: The'ir tae cum on aheid tae tha waddin!’ But agane the' pyed nae heed an the' gan aff - tha yin tae hïs fairm, an tha ither tae hïs bïzness.
second: An while the' wur aitin, he saed, “A tell ye tha truith, yin o yis ïs fer bethrayin me.” The' wur aa fu o sorra whaniver the' heerd thïs, an yin eftèr tha ither stairtit tae say tae hïm, “Shairlie ït's no me ye main, Loard?” Jesus saed, “Thair's yin that's dïppt hïs han ïn tha boul wi me wull bethray me.

first: An thair wus ithers tuk houl o hïs sarvints, traitit thaim wile baad an püt thaim tae deith.
second: A while latèr, whan Jesus wus at a dennèr at Mattha's hoose, thair wus a hale lock o tex men an ither fowk o ïll repute aitin alang wi hïm an hïs follaers.

first: Tha kïng wus ragein.
second: An that's tha raison tae thïs verie day ït's caad “Tha Fiel o Bluid”.

first: He sent oot hïs sodgers fer tae desthroy thaim murdèrers an he brunt thair cïtie doon.
second: But ïf A cast oot ïll spïrits bi tha Spïrit o God, ït proves that tha Kïngdom o God ïs here amang ye.

first: Then he saed tae hïs sarvints, ‘Tha waddin pairtie ïs readie, but tha yins A axt dïdnae desarve tae cum.
second: An yin o thaim, a thortie on tha Laa, tried tae ketch hïm oot wi thïs question: “Maistèr, whut's tha maist impoartin commaun ïn tha Laa?” Jesus saed, “ ‘Ye maun love tha Loard yer God wi aa yer hairt an wi aa yer sowl an wi aa yer mine.’ Thïs ïs tha furst an tha maist impoartin commaun.

first: Gang tae tha cross-róads an ax oniebodie ye fin tae cum tae tha waddin!’ Sae tha sarvints gan oot ïntae tha raas an the' gethert aa tha fowk the' cud fin, baith saint an sïnner, til tha waddin haal wus fu o guests.
second: Freen,’ he axt, ‘hoo dïd ye git ïn here wi'oot claes fït fer a waddin?’ Tha man haed naethin tae say.

first: But whaniver tha kïng cum ïn tae see tha guests, he saa a bodie thair that haednae waddin claes on hïm.
second: But cum an pit yer han on hir, an she'll cum bak tae life.” An Jesus got up an gaed wi hïm, as weel as hïs follaers.

first: Freen,’ he axt, ‘hoo dïd ye git ïn here wi'oot claes fït fer a waddin?’ Tha man haed naethin tae say.
second: Dae A no hae tha richt tae dae whut A laik wi ma ain siller?

first: Then tha kïng toul hïs sarvints, ‘Bine hïm han an fit, an clod hïm oot ïntae tha dairk, whar thair wull be greetin an scringein o teeth.’ Fer a hale lock o fowk ïs axt, but thair's no monie pïckt oot.”  Pyein Caesar hïs dues  Then tha Pharisees gaed oot an collogued thegither as tae hoo the' cud ketch Jesus oot ïn sumthin he wud say.
second: Then tha Kïng wull say tae tha yins on hïs richt han, ‘Cum, yous that ir blisst bi ma Faither; tak houl o yer inheritance, tha Kïngdom makkit readie fer ye frae tha time tha warl begun.

first: An sae the' sent thair ain follaers tae hïm alang wi some men o Herod's pairtie.
second: Fer jist as Jonah wus thrie days an thrie nichts ïn tha belly o a bïg fïsh, ïn tha same wye tha Sinn o Man wull be thrie days an thrie nichts ïn tha hairt o tha irth.

first: Maistèr,” the' saed, “we ken ye spake tha truith, an that ye taich fowk tha wye o God accoardin tae tha truith, wioot onie thocht o whut ither fowk thïnks o ye.
second: Tha wise yins but, they tuk jars o oiyle alang wi thair lamps.

first: Ye dïnnae mak o yin mair ner tha ither.
second: The' ir naethin but blin guides.

first: Sae tell iz, whut's yer thïnkin?
second: He stapt thair til Herod deed.

first: Is ït richt tae pye texes tae Caesar or no?” But Jesus kent thair wïckit mines, an he saed, “Ye hippycrates, fer why ir ye tryin tae ketch me oot?
second: Monie fowk ïs caad, but few sing'lt oot.]”  Yinst mair Jesus foretells hïs deith  Noo as Jesus wus on tha róad up tae Jerusalem, he tuk tha twal follaers aside, an he saed tae thaim, “Lïsten here, we'r fer Jerusalem, an tha Sinn o Man wull be bethrayed tae tha heid preeshts an tha maistèrs o tha Laa.

first: Show me tha coin ye pye tha tex wi.” The' brocht hïm a denarius, an he axt thaim, “Whase name an laikness ïs on ït?” “It's Caesar's,” the' saed.
second: Aa o a suddent, thair wus a michtie irthquake, fer an angel o tha Loard cum doon frae heiven!

first: Then he saed tae thaim, “Sae gie Caesar whut belangs tae Caesar, an gie God whut belangs tae God.” Whaniver the' heerd thïs, the' wur dumfoonèrt.
second: In amang thaim thair wus Mary Magdalene, an Mary tha mither o Jeames an Joses, an thair wus tha mither o Zebedee's sinns.

first: Sae the' left hïm an gan awa.
second: Dïnnae be feart o thaim that kïll tha bodie but cannae kïll tha sowl.

first: An aakwart question frae tha Sadducees  That same day tha Sadducees, that say thair ïsnae onie risin frae tha deid, the' cum an pit a question tae Jesus.
second: Tha ploat tae dae awa wi Jesus  Whaniver Jesus haed daen sayin aa these thïngs, he saed tae hïs follaers, “Ye ken tha Passower ïs tha day eftèr themorra, an tha Sinn o Man wull be hannit ower fer tae be nailt tae a cross.”  Then tha heid preeshts an tha eldèrs o tha fowk gethert thegither ïn tha palace o tha Heich Preesht, a man bi tha name o Caiaphas, an the' cumpluthèrt fer tae git tha houl o Jesus bi some sleekit wye, an pit hïm tae deith.

first: Maistèr,” the' saed, “Moses toul iz that ïf a man dees wi'oot leain onie weans, hïs brither maun merrie tha weeda an hae childèr fer hïm.
second: Whar dïd thïs man get hïs wusdom an mïraclis pooers frae?” the' axt.

first: Noo supposin thair wus seiven brithers amang iz.
second: Ma Faither haes made thaim places readie fer tha yins he's sing'lt oot.” Whan tha ither ten follaers heerd aboot thïs, the' wur wile ang'rie wi tha twa brithers.

first: Tha oulest gets merriet an he dees, an seein thair wur nae weans, hïs wife wus left tae hïs brither.
second: Tha yins wi nae wut tuk thair lamps but dïdnae tak eneuch oiyle alang wi thaim.

first: Tha same thïng happent tae tha saicont brither an tha thurd, richt on doon tae tha seiventh.
second: Sae, ïf ye ir brïngin yer offerin tae tha althar, an ye mine that yer brither haes ocht agin ye, jist lea ït doon fornent tha althar.

first: An bye an bye, tha wumman she deed as weel.
second: Wha ïs a sarvint ye'd caa faithfu an wise?

first: Noo then, at tha risin frae tha deid, whase guidwife wull she be o tha seiven, seein she wus merriet tae thaim aa?”  Jesus answert, “Ye ir no richt ava, fer ye dïnnae ken tha Scrïptures an ye dïnnae ken tha pooer o God!
second: Fer jist as tha lichtnin fleshes ower tha lïft, frae tha East tae tha Wast, that's whut tha cumin o tha Sinn o Man wull be laik.

first: At tha risin frae tha deid, thair wull be nae mair merryin; fer whaniver the' dee, fowk wull be laik tha angels [o God] ïn heiven.
second: Boaz wus tha faither o Obed, an tha mither o Obed wus Ruth.

first: But consarnin tha risin frae tha deid, dae yis no mine readin whut God saed tae ye: ‘A be tha God o Abraham, tha God o Isaac, an tha God o Jacob’?
second: He gaed ïntae tha Hoose o God, an hïm an hïs freens et tha halie showbreid.

first: He's no tha God o tha deid; he's tha God o tha leevin.” Whaniver tha croods heerd thïs, the' wur stoondit at hïs taichin.
second: Dae yis no see that whutiver gaes ïntae yer mooth gaes ïntae yer belly an then passes on oot doon tha drain?

first: Tha maist impoartin commaun  Hearin that Jesus haed left tha Sadducees wi naethin tae say, tha Pharisees got thegither.
second: As shuin as ïts brenches stairts tae bud, an ïts leafs cum oot, ye ken tha simmer ïs no faur aff.

first: An yin o thaim, a thortie on tha Laa, tried tae ketch hïm oot wi thïs question: “Maistèr, whut's tha maist impoartin commaun ïn tha Laa?” Jesus saed, “ ‘Ye maun love tha Loard yer God wi aa yer hairt an wi aa yer sowl an wi aa yer mine.’ Thïs ïs tha furst an tha maist impoartin commaun.
second: Becum laik wee childèr  Roon aboot that time tha follaers cum tae Jesus an axt, “Wha ïs tha maist thocht o ïn tha Kïngdom o Heiven?” He caad a wean til hïm an stud hïm amang thaim.

first: An tha saicont yin ïs laik ït: ‘Ye maun love yer nighber jist as much as yersel.’ Tha hale o tha Laa an tha Proaphits hing on these twa commauns.”  A question fer tha Pharisees  Noo whaniver tha Pharisees wus gethert roon hïm thair, Jesus axt thaim, “Whut dae ye thïnk aboot tha Messiah?
second: A tell ye tha truith, ye'll no git oot o thair afore yer last pennie's pyed!

first: Whase sinn ïs he?” “Tha sinn o Davit,” the' answert.
second: Eftèr a while tha ither lasses cum bak.

first: He saed tae thaim, “Then hoo ïs ït that Davit, spakin bi tha Spïrit, caas hïm ‘Loard’?
second: Jesus went bak ïntae tha Temple gruns, an while he wus taichin, tha heid preeshts an tha Jewish eldèrs cum up tae hïm.

first: Fer he says,  ‘Tha Loard saed tae ma Loard:  Sït doon at ma richt han,  tae A pit yer enemies unnèr yer feet.’  Sae ïf Davit caas tha Messiah ‘ma Loard’, hoo can he be hïs sinn as weel?” An naebodie haed a wurd tae say bak tae hïm, an frae that day on naebodie wud dar ax hïm onie mair questions.
second: Tha stairt o Jesus' mïnistrie  Noo whan Jesus heerd tha wittins that Jhone haed bin püt ïn jail, he went bak ïntae Galilee.

first: Seiven waes  Then Jesus saed tae tha croods an tae hïs follaers, “Tha maistèrs o tha Laa an tha Pharisees sïts ïn Moses' sait.
second: A guid man brïngs guid thïngs oot o tha guidness stored ïn hïs hairt; a wïckit man brïngs wïckit thïngs oot o hïs store o wïckitness.

first: Sae ye maun obey thaim an dae iveriethin the' tell ye.
second: An eftèr the' left, a man that wus bothert wi ïll spïrits an cudnae spake wus brocht tae Jesus.

first: But dïnnae dae tha same as thaim, fer the' dïnnae prectis whut the' praich.
second: An bein warnt ïn a draim no tae gae bak tae Herod, the' tuk anither róad bak hame.

first: The' tye up heavie burdens ower-wechtie tae cairt, an the' pit thaim on fowks' shoodèrs, but they thairsels ir no wullin tae lïft a fïng'r tae halp thaim.
second: Loard, hae mercie on ma sinn,” he saed, “fer he taks fïts an ïs sufferin wile baad.

first: Iveriethin the' dae ïs daen fer men tae see: the' mak thair phylacteries extrae wide an tha taussels on thair clokes extrae lang; the' love tae be at tha tap table at faists, an tae hae tha best saits ïn tha Meetin Hooses; the' laik men tae touch thair keps tae thaim ïn tha mairket places, an tae caa thaim ‘Rabbi’.
second: Is ït no tha yin that tha maistèr haes püt ïn chairge o tha ither sarvints ïn hïs hoose, tae gie thaim thair fair share o mait at tha richt time?

first: But yous ir tae let naebodie caa you ‘Rabbi,’ fer yis hae onlie tha yin Maistèr an yis ir aa brithers.
second: Tha stairt o Jesus' mïnistrie  Noo whan Jesus heerd tha wittins that Jhone haed bin püt ïn jail, he went bak ïntae Galilee.

first: An dïnnae caa oniebodie on irth ‘Faither,’ fer yis hae onlie tha yin Faither, an he ïs ïn heiven.
second: Blisst ir tha yins that warks fer peace, fer the' wull be caad sinns o God.

first: Nether let oniebodie caa ye ‘Leader’, fer yis hae onlie tha yin Leader, an that's Christ.
second: Awa an mak ït up wi yer brither furst; then cum bak an gie yer offerin ïn.

first: Tha maist impoartin amang ye maun be yer sarvint.
second: The'ir tae cum on aheid tae tha waddin!’ But agane the' pyed nae heed an the' gan aff - tha yin tae hïs fairm, an tha ither tae hïs bïzness.

first: Fer whaiver sets hissel up wull be brocht doon a peg, an whaiver hummles hissel wull be hel ïn heich regaird.
second: Whaniver he fun yin that wus warth a hale lock, awa he went an soul iveriethin he haed, an he bocht ït.

first: Wae faa ye, maistèrs o tha Laa an Pharisees, ye hippycrates!
second: Then tha yins that's daen richt wull shine brichtlie laik tha sin ïn thair Faither's Kïngdom.

first: Fer ye shut tha dure o tha Kïngdom o Heiven ïn fowks' faces.
second: Jesus foretells hïs deith  Frae that time on Jesus stairtit tae mak ït clear tae hïs follaers that he maun gae tae Jerusalem, an he maun suffer monies a thïng at tha hans o tha eldèrs, tha heid preeshts an tha maistèrs o tha Laa.

first: You yersels dïnnae enter, an yis'll no alloo thaim tae enter that's tryin tae git ïn!
second: Then Pilate axt hïm, “Dae ye no hear whut the'r chairgin ye wi?” But Jesus niver saed a wurd bak tae hïm regairdin onie o tha chairges agin hïm, an tha Guviner wus stoondit.

first: Wae faa ye, maistèrs o tha Laa an Pharisees, ye hippycrates!
second: If yer richt ee maks ye dae wrang, hoke ït oot an clod ït awa.

first: Fer ye swallae up weedas' hooses an ye mak lang prayers fer a show; sae yis'll be condemned aa tha mair.] Wae faa ye, maistèrs o tha Laa an Pharisees, ye hippycrates!
second: He's sufferin sumthin tarrible!” Jesus saed tae hïm, “Weel, A'm cumin tae mak hïm bettèr.” Tha centurion saed, “Loard, tha laiks o me's no fït tae hae ye cum unnèr ma ruif.

first: Fer ye trevel ower lan an sea tae git a sing'l convert, an whaniver he cums roon tae yer wye o thïnkin, ye mak hïm twice as much a sinn o hell as yis ir yersels.
second: Hïs follaers cum tae hïm an saed, “Wud ye tell iz whut that parable o tha weeds ïn tha fiel mains?” He answert, “Tha yin that sowed tha guid seed ïs tha Sinn o Man.

first: Wae faa ye, blin guides!
second: He maks hïs sin tae rise on tha wïckit as weel as on tha guid, an he senns rain on thaim that daes whut's richt, as weel as on tha yins that daesnae.

first: Ye say, ‘If oniebodie sweers bi tha Hoose o God, ït mains naethin; but ïf oniebodie sweers bi tha gowld o tha Hoose o God, he'll be hel tae hïs oath.’ Ye blin coofs ye!
second: Whaniver ït wus fu, tha fïshermen haaled ït ashore.

first: Whut's mair impoartin: tha gowld, or tha Hoose o God that maks tha gowld halie?
second: Or agane, hoo can oniebodie git ïntae a strang man's hoose an cairrie aff hïs belangins, less he furst tyes up tha strang man?

first: Ye say as weel, ‘If oniebodie sweers bi tha althar, ït mains naethin; but ïf oniebodie sweers bi tha gift on ït, he ïs bun bi hïs oath.’ Ye blin men!
second: Fer whar twa or thrie cum thegither ïn ma name, A'm thair amang thaim.”  Forgie yer brither frae yer hairt  Then Petèr cum tae Jesus an axt, “Loard, hoo monie times am A tae forgie ma brither whan he daes wrang agin me?

first: Whut's mair impoartin: tha gift, or tha althar that maks tha gift halie?
second: An dïnnae be thïnkin tae yersels, ‘We hae Abraham fer oor faither’ an hae daen wi that.

first: Sae, tha yin that sweers bi tha althar sweers bi ït, ay, an bi iveriethin on ït as weel.
second: Lïsten then tae whut tha parable o tha sower mains: Whan oniebodie hears tha message aboot tha Kïngdom an daesnae unnèrstan ït, alang cums tha Wïckit Yin an snaps awa whut wus sowed ïn hïs hairt.

first: An hïm that sweers bi tha Hoose o God sweers bi ït, an bi tha Yin that leeves ïn ït.
second: But consarnin tha risin frae tha deid, dae yis no mine readin whut God saed tae ye: ‘A be tha God o Abraham, tha God o Isaac, an tha God o Jacob’?

first: An tha yin that sweers bi heiven sweers bi God's throne, an bi tha Yin that sïts on tha throne.
second: Jesus gien thaim a guid warnin an saed, “Luk here, dïnnae you be tellin oniebodie aboot thïs.” But nae shuiner wur the' oot, than the' stairtit tae spreed tha news aboot hïm aa roon tha hale kintrie.

first: Wae faa ye, maistèrs o tha Laa an Pharisees, ye hippycrates!
second: Wus ït a proaphit?

first: Ye gie a tenth o yer gairden spices - yer mint, dill an cummin.
second: An he leeved bi aitin gresshoppers an wile honey.

first: But yis hae neglectit tha mair impoartin mettèrs o tha Laa - justice, mercie an faith.
second: He toul thaim that he maun be püt tae deith an be ris up tae life on tha thurd day.

first: Gie yer tenth, but dïnnae ferget tae be fair an kine tae ithers, as weel.
second: Sae let thaim be tha yins tae judge ye fer whut ye hae saed.

first: Ye blin guides!
second: He sent hïs sarvints tae tha yins that wus axt tae tha pairtie tae tell thaim tae cum - but the' wudnae cum.

first: Ye strain oot a mïdge, but ye swallae a kemel.
second: Then he gien thaim tae hïs follaers, an tha follaers gien thaim tae tha fowk.

first: Wae faa ye, maistèrs o tha Laa an Pharisees, ye hippycrates!
second: Maistèr,’ the' saed, ‘dïd ye no sow guid seed ïn yer fiel?

first: Ye waash tha ootside o tha bickers an tha plates, but tha inside o thaim's fu o whut ye got bi yer plunnerin an greed.
second: An a wile thrang o fowk follaed hïm, an he made aa thair seeck fowk bettèr, an he gien thaim a warnin no tae tell oniebodie wha he wus.

first: Blin Pharisee!
second: Blisst ir tha yins that greet, fer the' wull be comfortit.

first: Furst clain tha inside o tha bicker [an tha plate], an then tha ootside wull be clain as weel.
second: Maistèr,” the' saed, “Moses toul iz that ïf a man dees wi'oot leain onie weans, hïs brither maun merrie tha weeda an hae childèr fer hïm.

first: Wae faa ye, maistèrs o tha Laa an Pharisees, ye hippycrates!
second: Tha rain cum doon, tha wattèr ris, an tha wuns got up an hut agin tha hoose; yit ït dïdnae faa, acause ït wus bigged on tha roak.

first: Ye ir laik white-waashed graves, that luk quare an nice on tha ootside but on tha inside the'r fu o deid men's banes an iveriethin that's no clain.
second: An ïf summodie wants tae sue ye an tak tha shirt aff yer bak, let hïm hae yer tap-cóat as weel.

first: In tha same wye, on tha ootside fowk wud thïnk ye wur guid leevin, but on tha inside ye'r fu o hypocrisie an wïckitness.
second: Then he gaed up tha side o tha muntin an sut doon.

first: Wae faa ye, maistèrs o tha Laa an Pharisees, ye hippycrates!

first: Fer yis big tombs fer tha proaphits an fancie monuments fer guid men o lang syne.
second: It's masel.

first: An ye say, ‘If we haed hae leeved ïn tha days o oor forefaithers, we wudnae hae bin pairtie tae sheddin tha bluid o tha proaphits.’ In sayin that, ye'r wutnesses agin yersels.
second: Fer fauss messiahs an fauss proaphits wull rise up an dae michtie signs an wunnèrs; an fowk wull be tuk ïn bi thaim, ay, an ïf the'r able, the' wull fool even tha chosen yins as weel.

first: Ye'r bred frae thaim that murdèred tha proaphits, sae ye ir.
second: Fer iverie yin that haes wull be gien mair, an he'll hae mair ner eneuch.

first: Gang aheid, feenish aff whut yer forefaithers begun!
second: He tuk houl o hïm bi tha throat an saed, ‘You pye me bak whut ye owe me!’ Hïs fella sarvint faad doon on hïs knees an begged hïm, ‘Gie me time, an A wull pye ye bak.’ But he wudnae hear o ït.

first: Ye snakes!
second: Then ït gangs an taks wi ït seiven ither spïrits mair wïckit ner ïtsel, an the' aa gae ïn an the' settle thair.

first: Ye shooer o vipers!
second: Ye blin guides!

first: Hoo wull ye escape bein condemned tae hell?
second: But whan you pray, gang awa ïntae a ruim alane, shut tha dure an pray tae yer Faither ïn saicret.

first: Sae A'm gaun tae senn ye proaphits, an wise men, an taichers.
second: Then tha seed that faad doon amang tha thoarns, that's laik a bodie that hears tha message, but wi hïm chasin eftèr money, an tha bothers o thïs warl, tha message gets chokt an ït aa cums tae naethin.

first: Some o thaim ye'll kïll an hing on a cross; ithers ye'll whup ïn yer Meetin Hooses an ye'll hunt thaim frae toon tae toon.
second: Josiah wus tha faither o Jeconiah an hïs brithers.

first: Acause o thïs, on your heids wull faa tha bluid o aa tha upricht fowk that haes iver bin spïllt on tha irth, frae tha kïllin o that guid man Abel tae tha kïllin o Zechariah sinn o Barachiah - hïm that ye murdèred ïn tha Hoose o God atween tha Halie o Halies an tha althar.
second: Tha yeast o tha Pharisees an tha Sadducees  An whaniver the' crosst tae tha ither side o tha loch, hïs follaers dïdnae mine tae tak breid wi thaim.

first: A tell ye tha truith, tha judgemen fer aa thïs wull faa doon on thïs verie genèration.
second: Ay, Faither, ït haes plaised ye tae dae ït thïs wye.

first: Jesus' sorra ower Jerusalem  O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you that kïll tha proaphits an stane thaim that's sent tae ye, monies tha time A wantit tae gether yer weans thegither, laik a hen gethers hir lachter o wee burds unnèr hir wïngs, but yis wudnae let me!
second: Fer some ir eunuchs acause the' wur boarn that wye; ithers wur made that wye bi men; an ithers haes gien up tha chaunce o merriage acause o tha Kïngdom o Heiven.

first: Luk, yer Hoose haes bin forsook, an noo ït's empie.
second: Then cum bak, an follae me.” Whaniver tha young man heerd thïs, he wus doon ïn tha mooth an went awa, fer he wus quare an weel-aff.

first: Jesus foretells whut's aheid  As Jesus wus waakin awa frae tha Temple gruns, hïs follaers cum up an saed tae hïm, “Wud ye jist luk at thaim biggins!” “Dae ye see aa these thïngs?” he axt thaim.
second: The' brocht ït bak on a plattèr an the' gien ït tae tha wee lass, an she cairriet ït tae hir mither.

first: A'm tellin ye, no yin stane here wull be left abain tha ither; the'll aa be tummelt doon!”  An latèr on, as Jesus wus sïttin on tha Moont o Olives, tha follaers cum tae hïm on hïs lane.
second: Wae faa ye, maistèrs o tha Laa an Pharisees, ye hippycrates!

first: Tell iz,” the' saed, “whan wull aa thïs cum aboot, an whut wull be tha sign o yer cumin, an o tha enn o tha age?” Jesus saed bak tae thaim, “Tak heed an dïnnae let oniebodie lead yis aglee.
second: Tha fowk wur stoondit whaniver the' wutnesst tha dum spakin, tha crippelt makkit weel, lameters waakin an tha blin bein able tae see.

first: Fer monies a yin wull cum ïn ma name, sayin, ‘A be tha Christ’, an the'll lead monie fowk aglee.
second: An ïf ye ir wullin tae believe whut A say, Jhone ïs tha Elijah that wus tae cum.

first: Ye wull hear tell o wars an o taak aboot wars, but dïnnae be püt aboot.
second: An even eftèr ye saa thïs, ye dïdnae repent an believe hïm.

first: Fer sitch thïngs maun happen, but tha enn ïs no near jist yit.
second: An here cum up thïs man wi leprosie, an he got doon on hïs knees afore hïm an saed, “Loard, ïf ye hae a mine tae, ye can mak me clain.” An Jesus püt hïs han oot an toucht tha man.

first: Nations wull mak war on ither nations, an kïngdoms wull rise up agin ither kïngdoms.
second: The' haed follaed Jesus frae Galilee fer tae luk eftèr hïm.

first: Thair wull be dirths, [plagues] an irthquakes ïn monie pairts.
second: Jesus waaks on tha wattèr  Richt awa, Jesus made tha follaers get ïntae tha bóat an gae on aheid o hïm tae tha ither side, while he toul tha thrang tae gae hame.

first: Aa thïs ïs onlie tha stairt o tha bairin pains cumin on.
second: It ïs nae lang'r onie use, but fer tae be throwed oot an thrampt unnèr fit.

first: Then ye'll be hannit ower tae be persecutit an püt tae deith, an ye'll be haitit bi aa nations jist fer bein ma follaers.
second: Sae dïnnae fash yersels aboot themorra, fer themorra wull luk eftèr ïtsel.

first: At that time a hale lock o fowk wull turn awa frae tha faith, an the'll bethray an hait yin anither.
second: Sae ye maun obey thaim an dae iveriethin the' tell ye.

first: A hale lock o fauss proaphits wull rise up an lead monies a yin asthray; an acause wïckitness wull be on tha up, tha love o maist fowk wull growe coul, but tha yin that tholes tae tha enn wull be saved.
second: Whaniver tha Pharisees saen thïs, the' saed tae hïm, “Luk!

first: An tha Guid News o tha Kïngdom wull be praicht ïn tha hale warl as a wutness tae aa tha nations, an then tha enn wull cum.
second: Thaim men that wus hired last warkt onlie tha yin oor,’ the' saed, ‘an ye hae traitit thaim tha same as us that haes daen tha maist o tha wark an tholed tha hait o tha day.’ But he saed bak tae yin o thaim, ‘Freen, A'm bein fair eneuch tae ye.

first: Sae whaniver ye see ‘tha abomination o desolation’ stannin ïn tha halie place - tha abomination tha proaphit Daniel spauk aboot,” (Reader, ye'll unnèrstan ma mainin here) “then thaim at's ïn Judea maun tak tae tha hïlls.
second: An that's tha raison tae thïs verie day ït's caad “Tha Fiel o Bluid”.

first: Naebodie that's on hïs ruiftap shud gae doon tae tak oniethin oot o tha hoose.
second: Fer A tell ye that tha angels that luk eftèr thaim ir alang wi ma Faither ïn heiven, an the'ir readie onie mïnit tae spake up fer thaim.

first: An naebodie that's awa oot ïn hïs fiel shud be gaun bak fer hïs cóat.

first: In thaim days ït'll be tarrible fer weemen that's expectin, an fer mithers wi weans at tha breesht!

first: Jesus senns oot hïs follaers  Then tha eleiven follaers gaed tae Galilee, tae tha muntin whar Jesus haed toul thaim.
second: Sae the' tyed hïm up, the' maircht hïm aff an the' hannit hïm ower tae Pilate, tha Guviner.

first: Whaniver the' saen hïm, the' wurshipt hïm; but some aye haed thair doots.
second: Ye gie a tenth o yer gairden spices - yer mint, dill an cummin.

first: Then Jesus cum tae thaim an saed, “Aa thortie haes bin gien tae me ïn heiven an on irth.
second: Fer whaiver wants tae save hïs life wull loass ït, but hïm that loasses hïs life on ma accoont wull fin ït.

first: Sae gang an mak follaers o aa nations, baptisin thaim ïn tha name o tha Faither an o tha Sinn an o tha Halie Spïrit, taichin thaim tae keep aa tha commauns A hae gien ye.
second: Gae an tell hïs follaers, ‘He haes ris frae tha deid an he's awa on aheid o ye ïntae Galilee.
